projects.name: LEFT-OVER CARD

steps.instruction: Cut the pattern out of the front of the card
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a rectangle with internal lines dividing it into several irregular polygonal shapes.

steps.instruction: Glue the paper behind the openings and cut off the excess paper
Glue the coversheet on the inside to hide the 'mess'

tips: First check whether your left-overs fit the pattern and if not make a new pattern. It's of course also possible to draw a pattern on the card.
projects.finished_product_description: A card made from a double A6 card, with 7 pieces of patterned paper glued behind cut-out openings on the front, and an A6 coversheet glued inside.

diagram_descriptions: A small image showing a collage of red and floral patterned paper pieces arranged in a geometric pattern.
A diagram showing a rectangle with internal lines dividing it into several irregular polygonal shapes, representing the cut-out pattern for the card front.

projects.name: Japanese Window
projects.finished_product_description: A decorative window frame with Japanese patterns and a central motif.

diagram_descriptions: A square frame with a black border, divided into four panes. The background is a red and white Japanese patterned paper. One pane contains a small square with red Japanese characters. The other three panes show the Japanese patterned paper.

projects.name: Christmas Origami Card

steps.instruction: Cut out a corner of 3.75x3.75 cm from the card.
Glue the 7.5x7.5 patterned sheet in the middle of the card.
Keep the cut-out for later use.
Glue the plain coloured sheet in the 'hole' to make a square.
Cut two strips of 0.25x7.5 cm from the black paper and glue them on the horizontal and vertical middle of the glued-on square.
Cut four strips of 0.5x7.5 cm from the black paper and glue them on the square against the rim.
Cut the 7.5x15 cm patterned paper into four long strips and fold the long side 0.25 cm.
Glue these strips, with the folded side, against the black strips.
Cut the card into a square of 10.5x10.5 cm.
Fold or punch something you like from the leftover small patterned paper and glue it on the plain coloured square.

projects.finished_product_description: A Christmas origami card with a patterned square in the center, decorated with strips and a punched or folded element.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram shows a square divided into four smaller squares. The top-left, top-right, and bottom-left squares are filled with dots, representing patterned paper. The bottom-right square is solid grey, representing plain coloured paper. A thick black border outlines the entire square and the divisions between the top-left and top-right, and top-left and bottom-left squares.

Diagram shows a corner of a card. It depicts a square divided into four smaller squares, similar to the first diagram. The top-left and top-right squares have a dotted pattern. The bottom-left square is solid grey. The bottom-right square is white. A thick black border outlines the entire square and the divisions between the top-left and top-right, and top-left and bottom-left squares. A textured border is shown along the top and right edges of the card, suggesting the placement of additional elements.

projects.name: Kusudama "Portrait"

steps.instruction: Begin by forming the "Catamaran" base. This involves folding a paper into a hexagonal shape with a central horizontal crease and two diagonal valley folds.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a hexagonal outline with a central horizontal crease and two diagonal valley folds indicated by dashed lines and arrows. Below it, a photo displays a white paper catamaran base.

steps.instruction: From the catamaran base, fold one corner inwards, following the indicated crease lines.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of a square with diagonal creases forming an 'X', with a curved arrow indicating one corner being folded inwards. A photo shows a white paper unit with one corner folded, starting to form a pinwheel shape.

steps.instruction: Continue folding all four corners inwards, following the grid and crease lines, to complete the pinwheel shape.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of a square with a grid of creases and arrows indicating all four corners being folded inwards. A photo shows a white paper unit fully folded into a four-pointed pinwheel.

steps.instruction: Flatten the central square area of the pinwheel unit to define its shape.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the outline of the pinwheel shape with internal lines. A photo shows the white paper pinwheel unit with its central square area flattened.

steps.instruction: Push in the sides of the unit and make a mountain fold at the top. Use a finger to press down on one of the points to further shape the module.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of the pinwheel shape with arrows indicating pushing in the sides and a mountain fold at the top. A photo shows a finger pressing down on a point of the white paper unit to shape it.

steps.instruction: Continue shaping the unit, refining the folds to create a more three-dimensional, star-like module.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a more complex star-like shape. A photo displays the white paper unit with its points folded and shaped into a star-like module.

steps.instruction: Refine the folds of the star-like module, possibly creating tabs or pockets for later assembly.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of the star-like module with arrows indicating further folds and a dotted area at the top. Two photos show the module: one from a side view revealing its depth, and another from a top-down view showing the central structure.

steps.instruction: Assemble multiple finished units by connecting their points or tabs to form the complete kusudama.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing multiple units connected, illustrating the assembly process. A photo shows a single unit with its points folded back, ready for connection. Another photo shows several units partially assembled. The final photo displays a completed multi-colored kusudama with a small picture inserted in its central opening.

projects.finished_product_description: A multi-colored kusudama with a central opening, designed to hold a small picture or decoration.

diagram_descriptions: Title: Kusudama 'Portrait' by Kalashnikova Alexandra, Eniseysk, Russia.
Page footer: Christmas Origami Book 2010, page 8.

projects.name: Leaf from Lime-tree

steps.instruction: Fold both sides to center-line.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating folds towards the center. Arrows show the sides being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold down as indicated.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the diamond is folded downwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Close model. Rotate.
steps.visual_description: The model is closed, and a 90-degree rotation is indicated by a curved arrow and '90째'.

steps.instruction: Fold up the first layer. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The bottom layer of the model is folded upwards. An arrow indicates the upward fold. The instruction 'repeat behind' suggests the same action on the reverse side.

steps.instruction: Fold left part down while holding the right side as indicated. This will form a platform, seen in step VII) in 45째 angle to the rest.
steps.visual_description: The left side of the model is folded downwards, creating a platform. The right side is held. An eye symbol indicates viewing from the side. Arrows show the folding action.

steps.instruction: The result. Rabbit-ear fold will narrow the right part. Change point of view.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a 'rabbit ear' fold being applied to narrow the right side of the model. An eye symbol indicates a change in viewing perspective.

steps.instruction: Result of V) and VI). Fold hips behind. Round the corners. Narrow and form the upper part.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model after steps V and VI. Arrows indicate folding the 'hips' behind, rounding corners, and narrowing the upper part. A curved arrow shows a final shaping motion.

steps.instruction: Finished model.
steps.visual_description: A diagram labeled 'finished model' with an arrow pointing towards a photograph of the completed origami leaf.

projects.finished_product_description: A green origami leaf with a stem.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram illustrating step I: Folding both sides of a diamond shape to the center line.
Diagram illustrating step II: Folding the top point of the diamond downwards.
Diagram illustrating step III: Closing the model and indicating a 90-degree rotation.
Diagram illustrating step IV: Folding up the first layer and repeating behind.
Diagram illustrating step V: Folding the left part down to form a platform, holding the right side, viewed at a 45-degree angle.
Diagram illustrating step VI: Performing a rabbit-ear fold to narrow the right part and changing the point of view.
Diagram illustrating step VII: Showing the result of steps V and VI, with instructions to fold hips behind, round corners, and narrow the upper part.
Diagram illustrating step VIII: Labeled 'finished model' with an arrow pointing to a photograph.
Photograph of the finished green origami leaf with a stem.

steps.instruction: Precrease
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed and dotted lines indicating creases, forming a diamond shape with internal divisions.

steps.instruction: Fold fishbase
steps.visual_description: The result of step 1, showing the paper folded into a base shape.

steps.instruction: Fold an unfold angel bisector

steps.instruction: Opensink precreased parts
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with arrows indicating the opening and sinking of precreased sections.

steps.instruction: Fold right side behind

steps.instruction: Rotate the model

steps.instruction: Fold two big flaps up as indicated, take next step for orientation

steps.instruction: Fold the flap at the front down as shown

steps.instruction: Pull the paper at the bottom out a little

steps.instruction: Cut the pre-creased line, to get a triangle.

steps.instruction: Fold to the corner.

projects.name: Butterfly

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold it diagonally in both directions, creasing well, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A white square with two dashed diagonal lines and curved arrows indicating folding and unfolding along these lines.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper over. Fold it horizontally and vertically, creasing well, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A gray square with two dashed horizontal and vertical lines, and curved arrows indicating folding and unfolding along these lines.

steps.instruction: Collapse the paper into a preliminary base (also known as a water bomb base). Push in the sides along the creases made in steps 1 and 2.
steps.visual_description: A gray square with four triangular flaps, showing arrows pushing the side points inwards to form the base. The top and bottom points are visible.

steps.instruction: Take the top layer of the bottom flap and perform a petal fold. Lift the bottom point upwards, creasing along the existing diagonal lines and flattening the sides.
steps.visual_description: A square base with one flap lifted, showing a curved arrow indicating the lift of the bottom point towards the top center, and a new crease line forming.

steps.instruction: Repeat the petal fold on the other side of the top layer.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 4, showing the action on the adjacent flap, lifting the bottom point towards the top center.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over. Repeat the petal fold on the remaining two flaps on the other side.
steps.visual_description: The model turned over, showing the two remaining flaps being petal-folded, with arrows indicating the lift of the bottom points.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corners of the top layer inwards towards the center line.
steps.visual_description: The model with the top layer's bottom corners folded inwards, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Perform an outside reverse fold on the top point, folding it downwards to create the head.
steps.visual_description: The top point being folded downwards with curved arrows and dashed lines, creating a new point.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps (wings) downwards.
steps.visual_description: The model with the side flaps folded down, indicated by dashed lines and arrows, forming the basic wing shape.

steps.instruction: Perform an inside reverse fold on the tips of the wings to create the antennae.
steps.visual_description: The tips of the wings being folded inwards and upwards, indicated by arrows, to form small antennae.

steps.instruction: Fold the entire model in half along the vertical axis.
steps.visual_description: The model folded in half, showing one side overlapping the other, with the wings and antennae visible.

steps.instruction: Make a squash fold or spread fold on the wings to give them shape and volume.
steps.visual_description: The wings being opened and flattened, indicated by a curved arrow, to create a more three-dimensional butterfly shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami butterfly with distinct upper and lower wings, a body, and antennae.

diagram_descriptions: The top right corner of the page shows two finished origami butterflies, one larger and one smaller, in a flying pose, with their wings spread.
The page contains 12 numbered diagrams illustrating the sequential folding steps for an origami butterfly, starting from a square piece of paper and progressing to the final form.

projects.name: Origami Butterfly

steps.instruction: Fold the left flap to the right, aligning the edge with the center crease. Fold the bottom edge up to meet the horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a flap on the left. An arrow indicates folding the flap to the right. A dashed line and a solid line indicate creases. The number 13 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half along the vertical center crease.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 13 is shown, with a curved arrow indicating folding it in half. The number 14 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right flap down and to the left, creating a wing shape. Repeat on the left side. Fold the small triangular tip at the bottom upwards.
steps.visual_description: The folded shape from step 14. Arrows show folding down the right flap and then the left flap. A small triangle at the bottom is folded up. A circular arrow indicates a twist. The number 15 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Open the flaps slightly. Fold the bottom edges of the two front layers inwards, following the dashed lines.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 15, with the front flaps partially opened. Dashed lines indicate where to fold the bottom edges inwards. Arrows show the direction of the folds. The number 16 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section upwards, creasing along the horizontal line. Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 16. The bottom section is folded up. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards. The number 17 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right side inwards along the dashed line. Repeat on the left side. Fold the small triangular tip at the bottom upwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 17. Arrows show folding the top layers of the sides inwards. A small triangle at the bottom is folded up. The number 18 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edges of the two front layers inwards, following the dashed lines. Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 18. Arrows show folding the bottom edges of the front layers inwards and the side flaps inwards. The number 19 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section upwards, creasing along the horizontal line. Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 19. The bottom section is folded up. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards. The number 20 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right side inwards along the dashed line. Repeat on the left side. Fold the small triangular tip at the bottom upwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 20. Arrows show folding the top layers of the sides inwards. A small triangle at the bottom is folded up. A circular arrow indicates a twist. The number 21 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps outwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 21. Arrows show folding the two side flaps outwards. A circular arrow indicates a twist. The number 22 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layers of the wings down.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 22. Arrows show folding the top layers of the wings down. A circular arrow indicates a twist. The number 23 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edges of the two front layers inwards, following the dashed lines. Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 23. Arrows show folding the bottom edges of the front layers inwards and the side flaps inwards. The number 24 is below the diagram.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section upwards, creasing along the horizontal line. Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 24. The bottom section is folded up. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards. The number 25 is below the diagram.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami butterfly.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating steps 13 through 25 of an origami butterfly folding process.
A diagram showing the finished origami butterfly from a side view.
A diagram showing the finished origami butterfly from a slightly different angle.

projects.name: Kitten

steps.instruction: Fold the paper along the indicated curved lines.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. Two curved lines are drawn from the top corners towards the center, crossing each other. Arrows indicate folding along these curved lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half diagonally.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. Arrows indicate folding the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half horizontally and vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. Arrows indicate folding the top edge to the bottom edge and the left edge to the right edge, then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. A thick solid line indicates folding the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner, creating a diagonal crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper into a quarter circle shape.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. A curved line is drawn from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner, indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. A dotted circle indicates a circular motion. An arrow shows the top point being folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: A close-up view of a triangular shape with dashed lines. Two side flaps are shown being folded inwards towards the center. Circles indicate pivot points for the folds.

steps.instruction: Perform the indicated folds and tucks.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. Several curved arrows and circles indicate complex folds and tucks at the center of the paper.

steps.instruction: Complete the final folds to form the kitten's head and body.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines forming a grid of 4x4 squares. A dotted circle indicates a circular motion. An eye symbol is shown looking outwards from the center, suggesting the formation of the kitten's face.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami kitten standing on a base with intricate folds forming its body and head.

diagram_descriptions: A 3D isometric view of a finished origami kitten standing on a folded paper base.
Diagram showing the initial folds on a square paper.
Diagram showing a square paper folded in half diagonally.
Diagram showing a square paper with horizontal and vertical creases.
Diagram showing a square paper with a diagonal crease.
Diagram showing a square paper folded into a quarter circle shape.
Diagram showing a triangular shape with a fold indicated.
Close-up diagram showing inward folds on a triangular shape.

steps.instruction: Prepare the paper by making initial creases. From the top-left corner, create radiating creases towards the center and edges. Create a curved crease from the bottom-right corner to the left edge, passing through the center. A dashed diagonal crease runs from the top-left to bottom-right, and another from top-right to bottom-left.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with a circle in the top-left corner, from which multiple lines radiate. A curved line connects the bottom-right corner to the left edge. Dashed diagonal lines cross the square.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left corner inwards along the established creases, creating a small flap.
steps.visual_description: A zoomed-in view of the top-left corner of the square. A section of the corner is folded down, indicated by curved arrows showing the folding motion. Dashed lines show the previous position of the folded section.

steps.instruction: Assemble the paper using the existing crease lines to form the base.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper divided into a 4x4 grid. Solid diagonal creases run from corner to corner. A smaller square is outlined with dashed lines in the center, containing a star-like pattern of creases. Text below reads: 'assemble using the existing crease lines'.

steps.instruction: Orient the partially folded model. The eye icon indicates the viewing angle for the next steps.
steps.visual_description: A 3D perspective view of the partially folded origami base, showing multiple layers and angular folds. An eye icon with a dotted line points to the model, indicating a specific viewing direction.

steps.instruction: Perform reverse folds on the inner flaps at the top point, shaping them inwards to create a central peak.
steps.visual_description: The model is in a 'V' shape, viewed from the front. The top point has been folded inwards. Two curved arrows indicate the inward folding action of the central flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section of the model upwards along the indicated dashed line.
steps.visual_description: The model is elongated and viewed from the front. A dashed horizontal line marks a fold point across the lower section. A curved arrow indicates an upward folding motion.

steps.instruction: Shape the bottom point of the model. The dotted circle highlights the area for detailed work.
steps.visual_description: The model is now upright, resembling an animal head with two 'ears' or flaps at the top. A dotted circle highlights the bottom point of the model, and an eye icon with a dotted line points to this area for a detailed view.

steps.instruction: Collapse or shape the highlighted bottom point using the existing creases. Press the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: A zoomed-in circular view of the bottom point of the model. It shows a complex series of creases forming a diamond shape. Two black arrows point inwards from the sides, indicating a collapsing or pressing action.

steps.instruction: The result of shaping the bottom point, which is now more defined and tucked in.
steps.visual_description: A zoomed-in circular view of the bottom point of the model, showing the completed collapse and refined shape from the previous step.

steps.instruction: Fold the lower side flaps inwards to further refine the overall shape of the model.
steps.visual_description: The full model is shown again, similar to step 16, but with the bottom part now shaped as shown in step 18. Two black arrows point inwards on the lower side flaps, indicating a folding action.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble using the existing crease lines.

diagram_descriptions: The page displays a sequence of origami folding steps, numbered 10 through 19, arranged in a flow from the bottom-left to the top-right of the page. Each step shows a diagram of the paper model at a different stage of folding, with some steps including zoomed-in views or arrows indicating folding actions.

projects.name: Money Purse

steps.instruction: Start with a rectangular piece of paper. Fold the bottom edge upwards to meet the horizontal center line. Crease well.
steps.visual_description: A vertical rectangle with a dashed vertical line down the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge up towards the implied horizontal center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left and top-right corners inwards, aligning their edges with the vertical center line. Crease well.
steps.visual_description: A vertical rectangle with the bottom section folded up. Two curved arrows show the top-left and top-right corners folding inwards towards the vertical center line. Dashed diagonal lines indicate the fold lines from the top corners to the center point of the top edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge of the paper upwards, aligning it with the horizontal crease line that is approximately one-quarter of the way up from the bottom edge of the current shape.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house, with a triangular top and a rectangular base. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards to a dashed horizontal line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge of the previously folded section downwards, aligning it with the horizontal crease line that is approximately halfway down the folded section.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house, with a triangular top and a rectangular base where the bottom edge has been folded up. A curved arrow indicates folding the top edge of this folded section downwards to a dashed horizontal line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge of the paper upwards again, aligning it with the horizontal crease line that is approximately one-third of the way up from the bottom of the current section.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house, with a triangular top and a rectangular base where the bottom section has been folded in half. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards to a dashed horizontal line.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami money purse with a triangular flap and layered bottom section.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Initial rectangular paper with a vertical center crease indicated by a dashed line. A curved arrow shows the bottom edge being folded up.
Diagram 2: The paper after the first fold. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top-left and top-right corners inwards along dashed diagonal lines.
Diagram 3: The paper after folding the top corners. A curved arrow shows the bottom edge being folded up to a dashed horizontal line.
Diagram 4: The paper after the previous fold. A curved arrow shows the top edge of the folded bottom section being folded down to a dashed horizontal line.
Diagram 5: The paper after the previous fold. A curved arrow shows the bottom edge being folded up again to a dashed horizontal line.
Diagram 6: The final folded money purse, showing the result of all steps.

projects.name: Star Candle Holder

steps.instruction: Start with the white side on top. Fold the hexagon in half horizontally, bringing the top edge down to the bottom edge.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with a horizontal dashed line across its center. A curved arrow indicates folding the top half down to meet the bottom half.

steps.instruction: Unfold. Fold the bottom point of the hexagon up towards the center, aligning with the horizontal crease line. Repeat for the top point (implied by diagram and subsequent steps).
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with a horizontal dashed line. Small arrows point inwards from the left and right sides, and outwards from the top and bottom points. A curved arrow shows the bottom point folding up towards the center.

steps.instruction: All crease lines are now established, forming a grid of equilateral triangles within the hexagon.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon filled with a grid of dashed lines, forming multiple equilateral triangles across its surface.

steps.instruction: Continue folding along the existing creases. The diagram shows folding the top and bottom points towards the center, and also folding in the side points.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon, partially shaded in pink/orange, with a grid of dashed lines. Curved arrows indicate folding the top point down and the bottom point up towards the center. Small arrows point inwards from the left and right side points.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold creases as shown in steps 1-8 (steps 5-8 are on subsequent pages).

tips: Strong paper is more suitable than thin one, because the shape is more stable.
projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped candle holder designed to hold a tealight or small candle. It is created from a single ready-cut hexagon of paper.

diagram_descriptions: Photo showing the finished Star Candle Holder, a multi-colored star-shaped paper craft holding a white tealight candle.
Diagram 1: A hexagon with a horizontal dashed line in the middle, and a curved arrow indicating a fold from the top edge to the bottom edge.
Diagram 2: A hexagon with a horizontal dashed line. Curved arrows show the bottom point folding up to the center. Small arrows indicate points on the sides and top/bottom.
Diagram 3: A hexagon with a complete grid of dashed lines, forming a pattern of equilateral triangles.

Diagram 4: A hexagon, partially shaded in pink/orange, with a grid of dashed lines. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom points towards the center. Small arrows point inwards from the left and right side points.

projects.name: Star Candle Holder

steps.instruction: Start with a hexagon folded into a grid of triangles. Arrows indicate folding edges inwards.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with a grid of dashed lines representing creases. Arrows show the direction of folding on the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Fold one corner of the hexagon inwards following the curved arrow.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with a curved arrow indicating a fold from one corner inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the two bottom corners inwards.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with two bottom corners folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Reverse the red marked mountain creases into valley creases. Then turn the hexagon over.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with red dashed lines indicating mountain creases. An eye symbol with a curved arrow indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Fold the edge inwards while folding the corners to the centre. Repeat for each edge. The pink marked lines show the new position of the red mountain creases and the centre section of the edge.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon with arrows showing the process of folding corners to the center and the edge inwards. Pink and red dashed lines indicate crease positions.

projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped candle holder.

projects.name: Star Candle Holder

steps.instruction: Fold the point of the previously made triangle back to the opposite edge. Repeat for the other 5 points.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape made of 6 triangles. One triangle's point is folded back to the opposite edge, indicated by a curved arrow. Dotted lines show the previous folds. Arrows indicate folding points on the outer edges.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape with a hole in the center, showing the reverse side of the folded triangles. A small curved arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Fold the middle of the edges towards the centre of the hexagon along the existing valley creases. In the process push the two outer triangular areas (A and B) together. Please note: The model becomes 3D with 6 triangular flaps.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape with 6 points. A curved arrow shows folding the edges towards the center. Points labeled A and B are pushed together. Dotted lines indicate creases. Arrows show outward folds.

steps.instruction: Fold all 6 flaps to the right and left to make the existing creases sharp. (The diagram shows only 1 of 6 triangular flaps.) Finally open the flaps to a star shaped bowl.
steps.visual_description: A star shape with 6 points. A curved arrow shows folding a flap to the right and left, creasing it. Dotted lines indicate the crease. The final image shows the star opened into a bowl shape.

steps.instruction: You did it! Place a tea light in the Star Candle Holder and relax.
steps.visual_description: Two images of the finished Star Candle Holder. The first shows the holder from above, with colorful star points. The second shows the holder with a tea light placed in the center.

projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped candle holder made from folded paper, capable of holding a tea light.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 10: folding a triangle point back to the opposite edge of a hexagon.
Diagram showing step 11: the hexagonal model turned over, revealing a central hole.

Diagram showing step 13: folding flaps to sharpen creases and opening them to form a star-shaped bowl.
Image showing step 14: the finished Star Candle Holder from above.
Image showing step 14: the finished Star Candle Holder with a tea light inside.

projects.name: CD Case with Star

steps.instruction: Start with a circle of diameter 28-30cm. Fold it in half, then in half again, and then in half again, creating 8 equal sections. The center point should be marked.
steps.visual_description: A circle with dashed lines dividing it into 8 equal triangular sections, meeting at the center. A small circle and dot symbol is shown to the left.

steps.instruction: Fold the edge of one section to the center line (a). Fold the edge of the adjacent section to the center line (b).
steps.visual_description: The circle from step 1, with two adjacent sections folded towards the center. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds. Labels 'a' and 'b' are present. A curved arrow shows a fold line.

steps.instruction: Fold the edge of the section marked with 'a' towards the center line, aligning it with the previous fold. A dashed line indicates a fold.
steps.visual_description: The partially folded circle from step 2. An arrow shows a fold being made on one of the sections, with a dashed line indicating the fold line. A small circle and dot symbol is present.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges of the two sections marked with 'a' and 'b' towards the center line. The diagram shows two small circles indicating points to fold to.
steps.visual_description: The circle from step 3. Arrows indicate folds being made on two sections, with curved lines showing the fold paths. Two small circles are marked on the fold lines.

steps.instruction: Continue folding the edges of the remaining sections towards the center line, following the pattern established in the previous steps. A dashed line indicates a fold.
steps.visual_description: The circle from step 4, showing more sections folded towards the center. A dashed line indicates a fold, and a curved arrow shows the fold path. A small circle and dot symbol is present.

steps.instruction: The final folded shape forms a star within a hexagonal outer shape.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami star shape, with shaded triangular sections forming the outer part and white star-shaped petals in the center. The shape has 8 points.

projects.finished_product_description: A CD case or decorative star shape made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold a CD case with a star design.
Step 1: A circle divided into 8 sections by dashed lines meeting at the center.
Step 2: Two adjacent sections folded towards the center, labeled 'a' and 'b'.
Step 3: Further folding of section 'a' towards the center.
Step 4: Folding of sections 'a' and 'b' towards the center, with indicated fold points.
Step 5: Continued folding of sections towards the center.
Step 6: The completed origami star shape.

projects.name: Lighthouse Susanne

pieces.name: Lighthouse Crease Pattern
pieces.description: A rectangular crease pattern for a single sheet of paper.

details.line_styles: The pattern consists of horizontal, vertical, and diagonal fold lines. Horizontal and vertical lines alternate between dashed (valley) and solid (mountain) folds. Diagonal lines form repeating 'X' patterns, also alternating between dashed and solid.
details.annotations: Triangular symbols with numbers (0, 5, 8, 11, 21) are placed along the top edge, indicating specific reference points or sections of the fold sequence.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold the paper according to the provided crease pattern to form the lighthouse model.

projects.finished_product_description: A white origami model of a lighthouse, featuring a faceted base and a cylindrical body that tapers slightly towards the top, with distinct horizontal segments.

diagram_descriptions: Top image: A black and white photograph of the finished origami lighthouse model, viewed from a slightly elevated angle. The model is white, showing its intricate folds, a faceted base, and a multi-segmented cylindrical body.

Bottom image: A detailed black and white crease pattern for the origami lighthouse. It displays a grid of horizontal and vertical lines, with a complex arrangement of dashed (valley) and solid (mountain) diagonal fold lines. The grid is numbered 1-21 and 'a', 'b' along the top edge, and 1-16 along the left edge. Several triangular symbols with numbers (0, 5, 8, 11, 21) are positioned above the crease pattern, indicating key folding points or sections.

projects.name: Pustestern / Kreisel

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge up to the horizontal center line and crease. The dashed line indicates the fold.
steps.visual_description: A hexagon divided into 12 equal triangular sections by lines radiating from the center. The bottom edge is indicated by a dashed line. An arrow shows the bottom section being folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the center point. The arrow indicates the direction of the fold.
steps.visual_description: The hexagon from step 1, now with the bottom section folded up. An arrow shows the top point being folded down to the center.

steps.instruction: Make diagonal creases on the top section, forming an 'X' shape. Also, make horizontal and vertical creases as indicated by dashed and dotted lines.
steps.visual_description: The hexagon from step 2, with additional dashed, dotted, and 'X' shaped creases on the top section. An arrow indicates the next action.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards along the indicated lines. The dashed lines show the fold lines.
steps.visual_description: The hexagon from step 3, with the sides being folded inwards along the dashed lines. The text 'Gegenbruch n. innen' (Reverse fold inwards) is present.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the top point inwards to the center. The text '(Hintere Spitze zur Mitte)' means 'Back point to the center'.
steps.visual_description: The hexagon from step 4, with the top point being folded inwards to the center. A dashed line indicates the fold. The text 'Gegenbruch n. innen' is present.

steps.instruction: The shape is now forming a star. Some sections are shaded.
steps.visual_description: A six-pointed star shape, with alternating sections shaded. An arrow indicates the next action.

steps.instruction: Fold the points of the star inwards as indicated by the dashed line and arrow. Repeat this action 6 times.
steps.visual_description: The star from step 6. A dashed line and arrow show one of the points being folded inwards. The text '6x' indicates repetition.

steps.instruction: The star is further formed, with more internal folds visible.
steps.visual_description: The star shape from step 7, showing more internal structure and folds. An arrow indicates the next action.

steps.instruction: The star is complete. The text 'Anheben, fertig! Pusten!!' means 'Lift, finished! Blow!!'.
steps.visual_description: The completed six-pointed star, with alternating sections shaded. Small circles are drawn on some of the unshaded sections. The text 'Anheben, fertig! Pusten!!' is present.

projects.finished_product_description: A six-pointed star, possibly a Christmas ornament or a spinning top ('Kreisel').

diagram_descriptions: The page displays a series of 9 diagrams illustrating the steps to fold a six-pointed star or spinning top.
Diagram 1 shows a hexagon divided into 12 sections, with an arrow indicating a fold.
Diagram 2 shows the hexagon with the top point folded down.
Diagram 3 shows the hexagon with additional creases marked.
Diagram 4 shows the sides being folded inwards.
Diagram 5 shows the top point being reverse folded inwards.
Diagram 6 shows the partially formed star with shaded sections.
Diagram 7 shows a point being folded inwards, with a '6x' notation for repetition.
Diagram 8 shows the star with more internal folds.
Diagram 9 shows the completed star with shading and small circles, and text indicating completion.

projects.name: Heart on rack

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold the top two corners inwards along diagonal dashed lines, meeting at the center vertical crease. The bottom point has 'x' marks, indicating a reference or a fold that will be covered.
steps.visual_description: A square paper with the top two corners folded down, forming two triangles. Arrows indicate the folding direction. Dashed lines show the fold lines.

steps.instruction: Rotate the paper 180 degrees. Fold the top point (which was the bottom in step 1) downwards. Fold the two side points inwards along dashed lines, creating a more tapered shape at the top. An arrow indicates a fold at the top.
steps.visual_description: The paper is now inverted. The top point is folded down, and the side edges are folded inwards, creating a narrower top section.

steps.instruction: Fold the entire top section downwards along a horizontal crease. The side flaps are then folded outwards, indicated by a dotted line and an arrow.

projects.name: Penguin

steps.instruction: Start with a rectangular paper. Fold it in half vertically. Then, fold the top two corners down to meet the center crease, forming a triangular top (like a house roof). The bottom edge of the paper is indicated with a dashed line, and an arrow shows it being folded upwards.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper, folded vertically, with top corners folded down to form a house shape. A dashed line indicates a fold at the bottom, with an arrow pointing upwards.

steps.instruction: Take the 'house' shape from step 1. Fold the side flaps of the triangular top inwards along the existing creases. The 'X' marks at the top suggest a squash fold or similar action to flatten the top point, creating a smaller triangle.
steps.visual_description: The house shape from step 1, with dashed lines and arrows indicating inward folds of the top triangular flaps. 'X' marks are at the top point.

steps.instruction: The paper is now a narrower triangular shape, resembling a kite base or paper airplane base. Fold one of the side flaps over the center line.
steps.visual_description: A narrow triangular shape (kite/paper airplane base) with an arrow indicating one side flap being folded over the center.

steps.instruction: The paper is shown in profile. Perform a reverse fold to create the penguin's head and beak. Another fold is indicated at the bottom, possibly to create the base or feet. The letter 'L' might indicate a specific layer or point for the fold.
steps.visual_description: A profile view of the folded paper. Dashed lines and arrows indicate a reverse fold for the head/beak and another fold at the bottom. The letter 'L' is visible near the bottom left.

projects.name: Stiletto

steps.instruction: Start with the strap color side up, shoe color side down.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded into a diamond shape. Dashed lines indicate creases. Arrows show the bottom two points being folded upwards towards the center.
The paper from step 1, with the bottom points folded up. An arrow indicates a fold along the top edge.

steps.instruction: Swivel the sides in. The valley fold in the back layer should be parallel to the center line.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2, with the left and right sides folded inwards towards the center line. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. Dotted lines show the valley fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the layers around and inside the model.

steps.instruction: Like this.
steps.visual_description: The result of step 4, showing the current shape of the origami.

steps.instruction: Fold the toe up - first halfway, then up again.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 5. Dashed lines indicate where to fold the bottom point upwards. Arrows show the two-stage fold.

steps.instruction: Like this.
steps.visual_description: The result of step 6, showing the toe folded up.

steps.instruction: Thin the flap slightly less than 1/3.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 7. An arrow indicates folding the top point down, with a dashed line showing the fold line. The description indicates the proportion of the flap to be folded.

steps.instruction: Fold to the center. Don't go past the center or else the heel won't thin properly (step 29.)
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 8. Arrows show the sides being folded inwards towards the center line. A note references step 29.

steps.instruction: Along the creased edge.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 9, showing the result of folding the sides to the center.

steps.instruction: Along the center.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 10, with the model being folded in half along the center line.

steps.instruction: Unfold last 2 steps.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 11. An arrow indicates unfolding the last two steps.

tips: This model was designed on a friend's request for a "shoe."
I recommend foil only because of Steps 33 and 34, but the long flaps of Step 16 have a lot of potential, so feel free to make a new shoe with them!
Additionally, you can add toe detail by changing up Step 6.
A "left" or "right" shoe can be made by doing Steps 21-24 off-center, and adding the proper shaping in Step 33.
If you make two shoes, be sure to mirror image which strap goes over the other in Steps 34-35.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami stiletto shoe.

projects.name: Stiletto Shoe

steps.instruction: The following folds are highly intuitive. Detail the head. Swivel fold the ears and pull out the flap below to form the lower jaw.

steps.instruction: Shape the body. Perform reverse and petal folds on the back legs. Lightly shape the forelegs and perform a small 3d crimp at the neck area.

steps.instruction: Form the tail and shape the back. Shape the head to proportion.

steps.instruction: Start with a long strip of paper.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper into a triangular shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the triangular shape horizontally to create a narrower, elongated form.
steps.visual_description: The triangle is folded into a long, narrow shape with one pointed end and one jagged end. A curved arrow indicates the folding direction from left to right.

steps.instruction: Fold back a corner of the elongated shape.
steps.visual_description: The elongated shape from step 3 is shown with its top-right corner folded down, indicated by a dashed line. The text '3-4+' is written near the fold.

steps.instruction: Perform valley folds along the length of the strip as shown.
steps.visual_description: A long, wavy strip of paper with multiple dashed lines indicating valley folds. An eye symbol is present near the bottom-left.

steps.instruction: Continue folding to form a pouch-like shape.
steps.visual_description: A folded shape resembling a bag or pouch, with a jagged top edge and a diagonal fold line at the bottom-left.

steps.instruction: Adjust the shape, possibly by further folding or compressing.
steps.visual_description: A similar shape to step 6, but appearing slightly wider at the top and narrower at the bottom, with a small dashed line at the very bottom. The text 'Zoom out.' is present.

steps.instruction: Prepare to compress the stacked segments.
steps.visual_description: A stack of three oval-like segments connected by narrow sections, with a vertical arrow pointing downwards, indicating the direction of compression.

steps.instruction: Compress the paper down to form the final shape.
steps.visual_description: The final compressed, coiled, and somewhat cylindrical shape. The text 'Compress Down' is present.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow the folding sequence to create the coiled shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A coiled, compressed, cylindrical paper shape.

projects.name: aMetro kusudama

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangle with a dashed line down the center and a curved arrow indicating an upward fold.

steps.instruction: Fold in half again, but only pinch the middle to create a mark.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangle, folded in half, with a dashed line in the middle indicating a pinch mark.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangle, folded in half, with a dashed line and a curved arrow indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Perform a reverse fold. Repeat this action on the back side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded paper shape with a diagonal dashed line and an arrow indicating a reverse fold. A crossed-out arrow indicates repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold and then unfold. Repeat this action on the back side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded paper shape with a diagonal dashed line, a curved arrow indicating a fold, and a straight arrow indicating unfolding.

steps.instruction: Fold and then unfold. Open up the model at the indicated points.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded paper shape with diagonal dashed lines, curved arrows, and circles indicating points to open the model.

steps.instruction: Precreasing is now complete.
steps.visual_description: A precreased paper model, showing multiple mountain and valley folds forming a trapezoidal shape.

steps.instruction: Push the model to create a dent in the middle and then flatten it.
steps.visual_description: The precreased model from step 7, with a downward pointing triangle indicating pushing down in the middle, and then flattened.

steps.instruction: Fold and then unfold. Repeat this action on the back side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami unit with a curved arrow indicating a fold and a crossed-out arrow for repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold and then unfold. Repeat this action on the back side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami unit with a curved arrow and circles indicating a fold, and a crossed-out arrow for repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: The module is now finished. Identify the flaps and pockets.
steps.visual_description: A single completed origami module, labeled 'Flap' on two points and 'Pocket' on two other points.

steps.instruction: Attach five modules together.
steps.visual_description: Five completed modules partially attached together, forming a star-like cluster.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble 30 finished modules to form the complete kusudama.

projects.finished_product_description: A spherical, multi-faceted origami kusudama made from 30 units, with a star pattern visible on its surface.

steps.instruction: Start with the Waterbomb base. Fold in half and unfold. Push in the top.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with a dashed horizontal line across the middle. An arrow indicates folding the top point down to the dashed line and then unfolding. Another arrow indicates pushing the top point inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A trapezoid shape with a vertical dashed line in the center. An arrow indicates folding the right side to the center line and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a central vertical crease. An arrow indicates folding the top right flap downwards along the vertical crease and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Squash fold the top layer and insert your finger into the flap to guide the fold so it can be shaped into a pentagon shape as shown in the next step.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a central vertical crease and a flap on the right. An arrow indicates opening the top layer and flattening it. A finger is shown guiding the fold to create a pentagonal shape.

steps.instruction: It should look like this.
steps.visual_description: A pentagonal shape with two trapezoidal sections on the sides.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. Two dashed lines indicate folding the sides inwards towards the center, and arrows show the direction of the folds. The shape is then unfolded.

projects.name: Volcano Flower

steps.instruction: Preliminary fold.
steps.visual_description: A trapezoidal base shape with a central diamond-like structure. An arrow indicates a flap being folded upwards and to the right, revealing a new crease. A small circle highlights the pivot point of the fold.

steps.instruction: It should look like this. Now fold the point down and repeat steps 2 to 10 for the other 3 flaps.
steps.visual_description: A trapezoidal base with a tall, pointed, diamond-shaped structure in the center. A dashed line indicates a previous fold. An arrow shows the top point of the diamond being folded downwards.

steps.instruction: When all done it should look like this. Fold down the top layers as shown, note that it won't go corner to corner but rather a little bit down. Repeat on all 3 flaps and turn the model 180째 round.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top point flattened. Two dashed lines indicate folds on the top layers, with arrows showing them being folded downwards and outwards. A small '###' symbol is at the top. A separate circle with '180째' and an arrow indicates a rotation.

steps.instruction: Now, pull down the outer layers to create the leaves, the last one will work against it but just pull it, it will pop open.
steps.visual_description: A 3D-looking conical shape with a flat base. Arrows indicate the outer layers at the top being pulled downwards and outwards, suggesting the formation of petals or leaves.

tips: When pulling down the last outer layer to create leaves, it will work against it but just pull it, it will pop open.
projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami model of a 'Volcano Flower' with red and black marbled paper, showing multiple pointed petals opening upwards.

Diagram 11: Shows a diamond shape with the top layers folded down, indicated by dashed lines and arrows. A rotation of 180째 is also indicated.
Diagram 12: Shows a conical 3D shape. Arrows indicate pulling down the outer layers to form leaves or petals.

steps.instruction: Three outside reverse folds: on the left is the father, in the middle the tail of the mother, and the mother on the right.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal, elongated shape with multiple flaps. Three dashed lines indicate where outside reverse folds should be made to form distinct parts: one on the left for the 'father', one in the middle for the 'tail of the mother', and one on the right for the 'mother'.

steps.instruction: The result so far: one flap is left on the left, six flaps on the right. Fold two outside reverse folds, to form the heads of the parents.
steps.visual_description: A complex horizontal origami shape with several upward-pointing flaps, resembling figures. Two dashed lines indicate further outside reverse folds to be made on the right side to form the 'heads of the parents'.

projects.name: Origami Swans

steps.instruction: Two outside reverse folds on the left to form the son.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper shape with two birds. Dashed lines indicate folds on the left bird, labeled '1' and '2'.

steps.instruction: Crimp fold the head of the mother.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper shape with three birds. Arrows indicate a crimp fold on the head of the largest bird.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 17 six times on the right to fold the daughters. It is up to you, how you arrange them.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper shape with multiple birds. An arrow indicates folding on the right side.

steps.instruction: Now it looks something like this. Valley fold all the layers: this seems to be hard because of the thickness; fold the inner layers more than the outer ones. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper shape with many birds. A dashed line indicates a valley fold across the bottom. An arrow indicates folding behind.

projects.finished_product_description: Finished swans in divorce.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 17: Two birds, one with dashed lines indicating folds labeled 1 and 2.
Diagram 18: Three birds, with arrows indicating a crimp fold on the head of the largest bird.
Diagram 19: Multiple birds, with an arrow indicating folding on the right side.
Diagram 20: Many birds, with a dashed line indicating a valley fold across the bottom and an arrow indicating folding behind.
Final image: A row of origami swans, described as 'Finished swans in divorce.'

projects.name: Flag of Switzerland

steps.instruction: Mark centers of edges with small pinches.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating the center of each edge. Small marks are shown at these center points.

steps.instruction: Crease very lightly, connecting the bottom edge with the mark on the left, and the bottom-right corner with the top edge. Mark only the left edge. Repeat on the 3 other sides.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed line connecting the bottom edge to the left center mark, and another dashed line connecting the bottom-right corner to the top edge. A curved arrow indicates marking the left edge. The diagram shows this process repeated for all four sides.

steps.instruction: Valley-fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines forming a grid of 3x3. Curved arrows indicate valley folds along the horizontal and vertical center lines, and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Bring bottom-right corner to the center of the top edge. Only pinch on the left and unfold. Repeat on the 3 other sides.
steps.visual_description: A square with a curved arrow showing the bottom-right corner being brought to the center of the top edge. A small dot indicates where to pinch. The diagram implies this is repeated for all four corners.

steps.instruction: 4 valley-folds.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines forming a grid. Curved arrows indicate four valley folds, converging towards the center.

steps.instruction: Valley-fold edges to pinch-marks.
steps.visual_description: A square, oriented like a diamond, showing red sections and white cross. Curved arrows indicate valley folds along the edges, meeting at the pinch marks previously made.

steps.instruction: 4 mountain-folds.
steps.visual_description: An octagonal shape with a white cross in the center, on a red background. Curved arrows indicate four mountain folds along the outer edges, creating the final shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A model of the Swiss flag, made by folding a square piece of paper. The final model is octagonal with a white cross on a red background.

diagram_descriptions: A small circular icon showing the Swiss flag (red circle with white cross).
Diagram showing a square with dashed lines and marks for step 1.
Diagram showing a square with dashed lines and curved arrows for step 2.
Diagram showing a square with dashed lines and curved arrows for step 3.
Diagram showing a square with a curved arrow and a pinch mark for step 4.
Diagram showing a square with dashed lines and curved arrows for step 5.
Diagram showing a diamond-oriented square with red and white sections and curved arrows for step 6.
Diagram showing an octagonal shape with a white cross on a red background and curved arrows for step 7.
Diagram showing the finished Swiss flag model, a square with a white cross on a red background.
Diagram showing the finished Swiss flag model, an octagonal shape with a white cross on a red background.

projects.name: Pinwheel $ Gift Envelope

steps.instruction: Pinch center point.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines forming an X in the center.

steps.instruction: Bring one corner to center point & crease lightly.
steps.visual_description: A square with an arrow indicating one corner being folded to the center point. A small dot marks the center, and a dashed line shows the crease.

steps.instruction: Result.
steps.visual_description: A square with one corner folded to the center, creating a shaded triangle.

steps.instruction: Repeat for next 3 remaining corners.
steps.visual_description: A square with one corner folded to the center. Dashed lines indicate where the other three corners will be folded.

steps.instruction: Fold tip to edge.
steps.visual_description: A square with all four corners folded to the center. A dashed blue line indicates folding a tip to an edge.

steps.instruction: Repeat for next 3, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with folded tips. The final result shows a square within a square, with four triangular flaps pointing inwards.

tips: Discovered this playing with blintzes. Might already be out there, but I haven't seen rabbit-ear decoration one. Quite quick & easy.
projects.finished_product_description: A gift envelope with a pinwheel design.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first step of folding a square paper by pinching the center point.
Diagram showing the second step of folding a corner to the center point and creasing lightly.
Diagram showing the result after folding one corner to the center.
Diagram showing the square with one corner folded, and dashed lines indicating where the other three corners will be folded.
Diagram showing the folded square with a dashed blue line indicating folding a tip to an edge.
Diagram showing the final folded state of the gift envelope, with a square within a square and four triangular flaps.

projects.name: Pinwheel $ Gift Envelope

steps.instruction: Bring edge to center. Repeat for all.
steps.visual_description: An octagon with a dashed line across the bottom half, and a curved arrow indicating folding the bottom edge to the center.

steps.instruction: Result.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with a diamond in the center, formed by folded edges. The outer edges are dark, and the inner diamond is light.

steps.instruction: Rabbit-ear each corner tip. The tip should be pointed straight up, for effect.
steps.visual_description: An octagon shape with the bottom edge folded up to form two triangular flaps. Dashed lines indicate where to fold the tips of these flaps to create a pointed shape.

steps.instruction: Fold 1, then 2, etc. Tuck #4 flap under #1.
steps.visual_description: An octagon shape with the bottom folded up. Dashed lines and numbers (1, 3, 4, and a plus sign) indicate folding and tucking points. A 'N' shape is also visible near one of the folds.

projects.finished_product_description: A gift envelope shaped like a pinwheel.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing an octagon with a dashed line and an arrow indicating folding the bottom edge to the center.
A square with a diamond in the center, representing the result of step 7.
Diagram showing the bottom corners of the octagon folded into triangular flaps, with dashed lines indicating a rabbit-ear fold.
Diagram showing the folded flaps with numbered and dashed lines indicating further folds and tucks.

projects.name: Jakob's Stern

steps.instruction: Fold the square in half vertically, then unfold. Fold in half horizontally, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded in half vertically with a dashed line indicating the fold. An arrow shows the fold direction. A small diagram shows a circle with a semi-circle inside, representing a fold symbol.

steps.instruction: Fold the square in half diagonally, then unfold. Fold in half along the other diagonal, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded in half vertically and horizontally, showing the creases. Arrows indicate folding directions.

steps.instruction: Fold the four corners to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square with horizontal and vertical creases, and diagonal creases from the corners to the center. Arrows show the four corners being folded towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with creases forming a grid of 16 smaller squares. Arrows show the outer edges being folded towards the center vertical line.

steps.instruction: Make diagonal folds from the corners of the central square to the midpoints of the outer edges.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of creases. A curved line with an arrow indicates a fold from the corner of the central square to the midpoint of an outer edge. A small diagram shows a circle with a semi-circle inside, representing a fold symbol.

steps.instruction: Make diagonal folds from the corners of the central square to the midpoints of the outer edges.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of creases. A curved line with an arrow indicates a fold from the corner of the central square to the midpoint of an outer edge. A small diagram shows a circle with a semi-circle inside, representing a fold symbol.

steps.instruction: Collapse the model into a star shape.
steps.visual_description: A square with a complex pattern of red and blue dashed and solid lines, indicating mountain and valley folds. The center shows a star-like structure. A key indicates that red dashed lines are 'mountain' folds and blue dashed lines are 'valley' folds.

projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped origami figure.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial folds of a square piece of paper.
Diagram showing the paper after diagonal folds.
Diagram showing the paper after folding corners to the center.
Diagram showing the paper after folding edges to the center.
Diagram showing diagonal folds being made from the center square outwards.
Diagram showing more diagonal folds being made.
Diagram showing the final collapsed star shape with mountain and valley fold lines indicated.

projects.name: Christmas Star

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps inwards as shown.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded into a star shape with four flaps. An arrow indicates folding the flaps inwards. A small diagram shows a curved arrow indicating the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners of the central square inwards.
steps.visual_description: A square with a smaller square in the center. Arrows indicate folding the corners of the central square inwards. A small diagram shows a curved arrow indicating the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Tuck under the white square as shown here.
steps.visual_description: A star-shaped origami model with eight points. An arrow points to one of the points with the text 'Wie hier' (As here). A bullet point with text 'Unter das weisse Quadrat stecken' (Tuck under the white square) is present.

steps.instruction: The wings created in step 8 are positioned vertically and shaped.
steps.visual_description: A more developed star shape, likely the result of step 10. An arrow points to one of the 'wings' of the star, indicating it is being manipulated. Text below reads 'Die bei Schritt 8 entstandenen Fl체gel werden senkrecht gestellt und ausgeformt.' (The wings created in step 8 are positioned vertically and shaped).

projects.finished_product_description: A complex eight-pointed star, likely a Christmas ornament.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 8 of the origami process, with arrows indicating folds.
Diagram showing step 9 of the origami process, with arrows indicating folds.
Diagram showing step 10 of the origami process, with an arrow and text instruction.
Diagram showing step 11 of the origami process, with an arrow and text instruction.
A drawing of the finished origami Christmas star.

projects.name: Candy Cane

steps.instruction: Start with a square, colored side up. Valley fold vertically in half.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with a dashed vertical line down the center, indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Divide the paper in 4ths.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with three dashed vertical lines, dividing it into four equal sections.

steps.instruction: Further divide into 8ths. Note that the leftmost quarter of the square is divided with a mountain fold.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with seven dashed vertical lines. The leftmost quarter has a solid line down the middle, indicating a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Divide into 16ths. Note the mountain folds once again. Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with fifteen dashed vertical lines. The leftmost quarter has a solid line down the middle, indicating a mountain fold. An eye symbol with a downward arrow is shown above the square, indicating to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Divide the paper in 32ths. Note the mountain folds on the rightmost quarter of the square. Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with thirty-one dashed vertical lines. The rightmost quarter has a solid line down the middle, indicating a mountain fold. A circular arrow symbol is shown to the left, indicating to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the leftmost quarter.
steps.visual_description: A red square is shown with many dashed vertical lines. The leftmost quarter has a solid line down the middle, indicating a valley fold. A circular arrow symbol is shown to the left, indicating the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Pleat using the divisions made in the previous steps to get an accordion shape. The next step will be viewed from the top.
steps.visual_description: A red rectangle is shown with many vertical dashed lines, forming an accordion or fan shape. An arrow points downwards from the top edge, indicating the view for the next step.

steps.instruction: This structure and the ones in each subsequent steps apply to the whole length of the model. Spread the pleats in a star shape around an imaginary axis.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a series of V-shaped pleats viewed from the top, resembling a fan or a starburst. Two curved arrows indicate spreading outwards.

steps.instruction: Wrap two pleats around to close the cylindrical shape.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a star-like shape with multiple points radiating outwards. A curved arrow indicates wrapping around the center.

projects.finished_product_description: A candy cane shape made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold a candy cane from a square piece of paper.
Diagram showing a square piece of red paper with vertical fold lines.
Diagram showing an accordion or fan shape.
Diagram showing a starburst shape formed by spreading pleats.

projects.name: Candy Cane

steps.instruction: This is how the top view should look so far. Tighten the model by joining the middle points in the center.
steps.visual_description: A star-like shape with 8 points, viewed from the top. The points are slightly separated at the center.

steps.instruction: Curve each flap in one direction.
steps.visual_description: The star-like shape from step 10, with arrows indicating that each of the 8 flaps is being curved inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: The result of step 11. The next step will return to the front view of the model.
steps.visual_description: A spiral shape formed by the curved flaps, resembling a pinwheel or a swirl.

steps.instruction: The model should now appear like a long cylindrical shape that is half colored. Twist the shape to tighten it further.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin, cylindrical shape with alternating red and white stripes. A curved arrow indicates a twisting motion at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Curve the top section down in a hook shape.
steps.visual_description: The striped cylindrical shape from step 13, with an arrow showing the top section being bent downwards to form a hook.

steps.instruction: Candy Cane. Non-comestible. Using a mono-colored square results in a regular cane.
steps.visual_description: A completed candy cane shape, with a red and white striped pattern. The top is curved into a hook.

tips: Using a mono-colored square results in a regular cane.
projects.finished_product_description: A candy cane, which is non-comestible.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a star-like shape with 8 points, viewed from the top.
Diagram showing the star-like shape with arrows indicating the curving of each flap inwards.
Diagram showing a spiral shape formed by curved flaps.
Diagram of a long, striped cylinder with a twisting arrow at the bottom.
Diagram showing the striped cylinder with an arrow indicating the top section being curved into a hook.
Diagram of a finished candy cane with a hook shape at the top.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami genie lamp.

The pattern is symmetrical and shows intricate geometric folding.

steps.instruction: Front view of the head of the genie once collapsed. Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a folded paper object that resembles a lamp's head, with a square base and a tapering top. The paper is creased and folded to create segments.

steps.instruction: Pleat the long flap 1 unit down using the front grid as reference.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding the same paper object as in step 1, but from a different angle. A long flap is shown being folded down. Dashed lines indicate where the fold should occur. An arrow points downwards, indicating the direction of the fold. A zig-zag line is drawn on the surface, possibly indicating a crease or a feature of the model.

steps.instruction: Valley fold both sides of the front layer of the long flap while swivel folding the bottom. The model will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a white origami model. The top part of the model is a long, thin flap. Dashed lines indicate valley folds on the sides of the flap. Arrows show a curved folding motion at the top of the flap.

steps.instruction: Pleat the long flap down like in step 2.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a white origami model. The long flap at the top is being folded downwards. Dashed lines indicate pleat folds. A downward arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear fold the top of the long flap backwards. This will flatten the model.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a white origami model. The top of the long flap is being folded backwards. Dashed lines indicate the fold. A curved arrow shows the folding motion.

steps.instruction: Open up all the layers of the long flap. The model will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a white origami model. The layers of the long flap are being opened up. Curved arrows indicate the opening motion.
