projects.name: Star within a Star

materials.color: multiple colors (e.g., pink, blue, white as shown in finished product)

steps.instruction: Place the paper with the color side down. Fold the Kite base.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. Dashed lines indicate mountain folds along the diagonals from the top-left and top-right corners to the bottom-right corner. A solid line indicates a valley fold from the top-left corner to the bottom-left corner. The bottom-right corner is the apex of the kite.

steps.instruction: Fold a preliminary base on the imaginary square formed from the top and left sides of the white triangle.
steps.visual_description: The kite base is shown with the bottom section folded up, creating two orange triangles and a white triangle at the top. An arrow indicates folding the top-left corner down along a diagonal crease, forming a preliminary base.

steps.instruction: Turn over and complete the pre-crease for the preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown turned over (indicated by a circular arrow). Dashed lines indicate a grid of creases across the entire surface, including horizontal, vertical, and diagonal lines. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom points towards the center.

steps.instruction: Collapse the preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base is shown collapsed, with the top and bottom points folded inwards, forming a smaller diamond shape. A circular arrow with '45' indicates rotating the model 45 degrees.

steps.instruction: Sink the left corner (you can pre-crease before the angle bisector). Open up the right flap.
steps.visual_description: The collapsed base is shown. The top point is being sunk inwards, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow. The right flap is shown partially opened, revealing an inner layer.

steps.instruction: Fold as marked, while allowing point A to move (without any fold!) to point B.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded model is shown. A curved arrow indicates a fold on the right side. Point A is marked at the base of a flap, and point B is marked further up on the edge, indicating the target position for point A after the fold. Dashed lines show internal structure.

details.line_style: dashed and solid lines as shown in step 1

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The project requires 6-8 units to be folded and assembled to form the 'Star within a Star' model.

projects.finished_product_description: A modular origami star composed of multiple units. The finished model features an eight-pointed outer star with alternating colors (pink and blue) and a smaller, eight-pointed inner star in white.

diagram_descriptions: A table providing project details: 'Star within a Star', '2009', 'Design: Ilan Garibi', 'Units: 6-8', 'Diagrams: Ilan Garibi', 'http://www.flickr.com/photos/garibiilan/', 'garibiilan@gmail.com', 'Color side', 'Down'.

A photograph of the finished 'Star within a Star' origami model. It displays an eight-pointed star with alternating pink and blue outer points and a white inner star, set against a white background with a 'GARIBI' watermark.
Diagram 1: Illustrates the initial folds for a kite base on a square piece of paper, showing diagonal mountain and valley folds.
Diagram 2: Shows the progression of folding a preliminary base from the kite base, with an arrow indicating a fold of the top-left corner.
Diagram 3: Depicts the model turned over, with dashed lines indicating pre-creases for the preliminary base and curved arrows showing folds towards the center.
Diagram 4: Illustrates the collapsed preliminary base, forming a smaller diamond shape, with a '45' degree rotation arrow.
Diagram 5: Shows the process of sinking the left corner and opening up the right flap of the collapsed base, with a dashed line and arrow indicating the sink fold.
Diagram 6: Details a specific fold, marked by a curved arrow, instructing to allow point A to move to point B without creating an additional fold.

projects.name: Star within a Star

steps.instruction: Fold all the flaps on the right behind to create the tab.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of a single origami unit, showing flaps being folded behind to form a tab labeled 'A'.

steps.instruction: Connection is straight forward - insert the tab into the pocket. Add 6 more units to complete.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing two origami units being connected. One unit has a tab, and the other has a pocket. The tab is being inserted into the pocket.

steps.instruction: Here you can see 4 units connected. Add 4 more to complete the model, or only 2 more units, to get a lovely 3D effect.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing four origami units connected together, forming a partial star shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A 3D star shape made from multiple connected origami units.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: This is a complex origami diagram with multiple fold lines indicating the construction of the 'Demon Guy' model.

projects.finished_product_description: Two photographs of a white origami figure, identified as 'Demon Guy'. The figure has multiple folded points resembling horns or limbs, a segmented body, and appears to be standing. The background is a patterned wallpaper in shades of green, blue, and purple.

steps.instruction: Start with a square color side up (I started with white side up because I want my final model to be white). I usually use just regular copy paper, and suggest that for your first try because of a later step. Start by mountain folding the diagonals and creasing a 16x16 grid.

steps.instruction: Closed sink the "1" box into the "3" box. This is an in - out sink. This is a tough step, all I can say is good luck! Keep the layers locked, make sure it is a closed sink.

Make sure it is a closed sink

projects.name: Miura-ken Beauty Rose - Simplified with variations

materials.dimensions: at least with more than 33 ruled lines

steps.instruction: Fold the A4 size paper at corner and identify the square. The extra paper is folded behind with mountain fold. Make a pinch at the right corner at 1/5 length
steps.visual_description: A crease pattern diagram showing a grid of squares and triangles, with horizontal lines marked at intervals labeled 6/10, 6/10, 7/10, 7/10, 8/10, 8/10, 9/10, 9/10, 10/10, 10/10. Below the grid are vertical labels 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The crease pattern is reproduced below the material list. The method involves folding the paper at the corner, identifying a square, and folding the extra paper behind with a mountain fold. A pinch is made at the right corner at 1/5 length.

tips: This means you have pinch mark on left of, left over rectangle, after cutting the exact square. This extra strip with 1/5mark will be used as reference points scale for the horizontal creases. Now with the help of ruled paper where in you in corporate 0,1,2,3 etc on rows of ruled paper and by putting 0 numbered line at corner of the square paper which we are going to fold and multiple of 11 number line on the other side make vertical eleven creases all of equal length.
projects.finished_product_description: A simplified Miura-ken Beauty Rose with variations.

diagram_descriptions: A crease pattern diagram showing a grid of squares and triangles. Horizontal lines are marked at intervals labeled 6/10, 6/10, 7/10, 7/10, 8/10, 8/10, 9/10, 9/10, 10/10, 10/10. Below the grid are vertical labels 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11, 1/11.

projects.name: Simpler Rose Model with Less Petals

steps.instruction: Divide the 1/5th distance in 8 equal parts of extra strip paper and use it to mark horizontal 5 divisions which are progressively in creasing as 6, 7, 8 and 9.
From one corner, mark the 6th division of our tool. Then place the starting point of the tool on this mark just made and go to 7th division and mark 2nd crease.
The 5 horizontal divisions are further divided in half  of each section. Thus we are now ready with the base for the model with 10 horizontal and 11 vertical creases.
Orient the paper as shown in C.P.Diagram. such that left corner has the smallest rectangle of 6/80 division by 1/11.
steps.visual_description: C.P.Diagram showing paper orientation with a small rectangle in the left corner.

steps.instruction: Pleat horizontally and unfold. Now fold 2nd vertical column, as mountain fold (also first horizontal fold should be mountain fold) and press this mountain fold between 1st and 3rd horizontal folds with inside reverse fold until next vertical fold. towards third column inside pleated horizontal folds.
steps.visual_description: Paper with horizontal pleats, then a mountain fold on the 2nd vertical column, pressed between 1st and 3rd horizontal folds with an inside reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Carry on this operation for every alternate column with mountain fold. You will have to lock the model when you reach 11th column with the 1st one.

tips: Shaping: Your skills will play an important part for this activity. Look at the finishing by the Designer himself and let nature guide you. There can not be any fixed criteria.
projects.finished_product_description: A pentagonal base for a rose model.

projects.name: LESSON 1-Variation 1st (4X4 petals) { 8X 9 grid } equal lengths on each side

steps.instruction: The basic principle is to have multiple rectangles and the size changes as we vary row lengths. This also gives a pentagonal shape. Kawasaki rose is in squares, so why not consider similar construction was the thought and hence 8 equal length rows and 9 equal length columns were thought of and the base was made.
steps.visual_description: A pentagonal shape formed by multiple rectangles.

steps.instruction: To amplify, keeping in view similar crease pattern divide the square paper with 8 equal division row folds with color side up. Then 9 equal length folds vertically. Actual folding method is to pleat horizontal folds like fan-- one mountain and next valley. Then start from 1st horizontal fold (mountain fold.) And push the in-between mountain fold on the vertical crease between 2nd and 3rd column by inside reverse fold, which is a mountain fold. Continue this way all layers. Lock the 1st raw edge with the last edge. The result will be square type layered structure. Now shape this by gumming calyx and curling all the 16 petals. This gave good result after finish and was easy to fold.
steps.visual_description: Square paper divided into 8 rows and 9 columns. Layers of pleats resembling a fan. A layered square structure with 16 petals.

projects.finished_product_description: A rose model with 16 petals.

projects.name: LESSON 2- Variation 2nd {8X11 Grid} equal length on each side (4x5 petals) [more petals]

steps.instruction: This gives us thought to further increase of the petals by using initial paper of rectangle size. So we can use A4 size paper and have 8 horizontal rows of equal length as in Variation one  {4x4 petals } (8x9grid) .but columns of equal width can be more than 9 actually 12 so you can cut the paper at 11th division to increase one more layer.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle paper, possibly A4 size, with 8 horizontal rows and more than 9 columns.

steps.instruction: Keeping the similar crease pattern fold the base as in variation one.(Please note that for columns ,first square length is divided in1/9equallength and then extend this division to the extra paper and cut the rectangle after 11 vertical folds and use this rectangle for folding the model.
steps.visual_description: A folded base similar to variation one, with columns divided and extended to cut a rectangle after 11 vertical folds.

projects.finished_product_description: A rose model with potentially more than 16 petals.

projects.name: PAGE ROSE Variation 3rd- [4X4 petals ] ( 8x9 grid with reducing size of petals towards centre)

steps.instruction: This has multiples of 4 petals but actually in nature you have more varieties of rose with pentagonal shape , but for simplicity the thought was to have structure of 4 petals layered up .It will be simpler. With this thought I thought of 8 rows and 9 columns base. For the Kawasaki rose, there is one variation by Maria called as M aria's pentagonal rose. [There is also one more rose with more petals designed by Phu Tran]. Where as here we are adopting a reverse method that is from pentagonal base we are coming down to rectangular base. Actually the 8 horizontal rows can be mainly considered as 4 rows of different width divided among themselves in half.
steps.visual_description: A pentagonal rose shape with petals reducing in size towards the center. A rectangular base is formed from a pentagonal base.

projects.finished_product_description: A rose model with 4 petals layered, reducing in size towards the center.

diagram_descriptions: C.P.Diagram showing paper orientation with a small rectangle in the left corner.

projects.name: Rose

steps.instruction: Divide horizontal length in 1/9. Mark 3, 4, 5, and 6 lengths which total up to 18, a multiple of 9. Divide horizontal length in 18 equal parts but use 3, 4, 5, 6 lengths as main folds for rows. Fold each division in half to get 8 rows. Divide length in 9 equal parts for columns. Thus the square is divided in 8 rows and 9 columns.
Bring all vertices of each layer to the center, one layer after other. Twist central layer with twister.
Prepare calyx and gum it to your model. Shape it by curling each petal and giving a slight gap in each layer by pulling the central twisted structure slightly.
For the inner most layer, bring all 4 vertices together. Use twister to twist clockwise tightly to the extent possible. This will give a natural like shape to the model.
For the 2nd layer, shape the vertices making them like water bomb base on each side and turn outside bit tightly.
For the 3rd layer, use the same method.

tips: Increasing the petals was not successful as locking is not possible. If we change the divisional width of rows it may be possible and needs to be explored.
Use twister to twist clockwise tightly to the extent possible.
Shape the vertices making them like water bomb base on each side and turn outside bit tightly.
projects.finished_product_description: A folded rose with a calyx.

steps.instruction: Pivot on corner C, fold to centre line. Crease to locate point P.

steps.instruction: Fold to P.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps down.

steps.instruction: Squash fold them up.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps up, like Step 13.

steps.instruction: Squash fold them down, like Step 14.
steps.visual_description: The origami model after folding the bottom flaps up. The instruction is to perform a squash fold downwards on these flaps, mirroring the action in Step 14.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the edges behind, parallel to the center line, as far as they will go.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from the previous step. The instruction is to mountain fold the edges of the model inwards, parallel to the central vertical line, extending the fold as much as possible.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the edges of the bottom half to match up with the top ones.

Six images arranged in two rows of three, showing sequential steps of an origami folding process. Each image displays a portion of the origami model against a green background. The steps are numbered 13 through 18, with accompanying text instructions.
Image 1 (Step 13): Shows the origami model with flaps ready to be folded down.
Image 2 (Step 14): Shows the model after the flaps have been squash-folded upwards.
Image 3 (Step 15): Shows the model with bottom flaps folded up.
Image 4 (Step 16): Shows the model after a downward squash fold on the bottom flaps.
Image 5 (Step 17): Shows the model with edges being mountain folded inwards.
Image 6 (Step 18): Shows the model with bottom edges mountain folded to align with the top.

projects.name: Merlion

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: This page contains a diagram for folding a Merlion origami figure. The diagram shows a grid of lines on a blue background, indicating the folds required to create the origami model. There are no explicit steps or material lists provided on this page.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami figure of a Merlion, a mythical creature that is half lion and half fish. The origami is depicted in blue and white.

diagram_descriptions: A geometric diagram on a blue background with white lines, illustrating the folding pattern for an origami Merlion. The pattern is complex, with many intersecting lines forming triangles and quadrilaterals.
A small, stylized origami representation of a Merlion, colored in shades of blue and white, positioned in the top right corner of the page.
The title 'Merlion' is displayed in a decorative blue font at the top of the page.
The text 'by Jared Needle 짤 2010' is displayed below the title.
The text 'Christmas Origami Book 2010' is displayed at the bottom left of the page.
The page number '115' is displayed at the bottom right of the page.

projects.name: Very simple fish

steps.instruction: Precrease lightly a preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees, with dashed lines indicating creases for a preliminary base.

steps.instruction: Fold 1/2 preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees, with dashed and dotted lines indicating creases from the previous step.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a dashed line indicating an inside reverse fold. An arrow shows the direction of the fold. The fold is approximately 1/3 of the way down the flap.

steps.instruction: Valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a fish body with a tail fin. A dashed line indicates a valley fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold again and unfold to step 3.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a fish body with a tail fin. A curved arrow indicates a valley fold and then unfolding back to a previous state.

steps.instruction: Reverse the creases of steps 4 and 5.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a fish body with a tail fin. Dashed and dotted lines indicate creases from previous steps.

projects.finished_product_description: A simple origami fish.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 4,5,6 on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami figure, showing a fold line on the top surface and a curved arrow indicating an action on the right side.

steps.instruction: Precrease lightly.
steps.visual_description: A folded origami figure with dashed lines indicating precreases on the top surface.

steps.instruction: Crimp.
steps.visual_description: A folded origami figure with three wavy arrows pointing towards a central fold line, indicating a crimp action.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold the face, shape the fins.
steps.visual_description: A folded origami figure showing dashed and dotted lines on the left side, indicating an inside reverse fold for the face, and the fins are shaped.

projects.name: origami betafish

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold and unfold along both diagonals and both horizontal and vertical midlines to create creases. The vertical midline is a mountain fold (dash-dot line), and the horizontal midline and diagonals are valley folds (dashed lines).
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal creases and a horizontal midline, and a dash-dot line indicating a vertical midline. Curved arrows show the paper being folded and unfolded along these lines.

steps.instruction: Bring the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal crease, and the left and right edges to the center vertical crease, collapsing the paper to form a smaller square. This is the preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: A square with existing creases. Curved arrows with solid arrowheads indicate folding the four corners/edges inwards towards the center, collapsing the paper.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the triangle down along a horizontal dashed crease line.
steps.visual_description: A gray triangle shape. A horizontal dashed line is visible near the top. A curved arrow indicates folding the top point down along this line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom left and right corners of the triangle upwards along diagonal dashed crease lines.
steps.visual_description: A gray triangle shape with a horizontal dashed line. Curved arrows indicate folding the bottom left and right corners upwards along diagonal dashed lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layers of the side flaps inwards along diagonal dashed crease lines.
steps.visual_description: A gray triangle shape with multiple horizontal and diagonal creases. Curved arrows indicate folding the top layers of the side flaps inwards along new diagonal dashed lines.

steps.instruction: Perform reverse folds on the tips of the side flaps, creating smaller points.
steps.visual_description: A gray triangle shape with multiple creases. Curved arrows with zig-zag lines indicate reverse folds being performed on the tips of the side flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edges of the model upwards. The small arrow with a cross indicates a shaping or specific fold at the top point.
steps.visual_description: A gray model resembling a small pyramid on a flat base. Curved arrows indicate folding the bottom edges upwards. A small arrow with a cross indicates a specific fold or shaping at the top point.

steps.instruction: Perform a reverse fold on the top point, and shape the bottom part of the model.
steps.visual_description: A gray model showing a reverse fold being performed on the top point (indicated by a curved arrow and a dash-dot line). A solid black arrow indicates a fold or shaping at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 8 on the other side. Shape the fins and tail of the betafish.
steps.visual_description: The finished origami betafish model, showing the results of the folds from step 8 on both sides, with distinct fins and a tail. Text 'step 8' with arrows points to the shaped side fins.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami betafish with distinct fins and tail.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a square paper with initial crease lines for diagonals and midlines.
Diagram 2 shows the process of collapsing the paper to form a preliminary base.
Diagram 3 shows folding down the top layer of a triangular base.
Diagram 4 shows folding up the bottom corners of the triangular base.
Diagram 5 shows folding inwards the top layers of the side flaps.
Diagram 6 shows performing reverse folds on the tips of the side flaps.
Diagram 7 shows folding up the bottom edges and a shaping indication at the top.
Diagram 8 shows performing a reverse fold on the top point and shaping the bottom.
Diagram 9 shows the completed origami betafish, indicating repeated steps for symmetry.

projects.name: Origami Betafish

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down and to the side as indicated by the arrows.
steps.visual_description: A paper shape resembling a fish tail with the top point folded down and to the right, indicated by curved arrows.

steps.instruction: Pinch the sides of the paper inwards.
steps.visual_description: The paper shape from step 10 is shown with arrows indicating pinching the sides inwards. Black arrow shapes suggest the direction of force.

steps.instruction: Make small folds on the top point as indicated by the arrows, referencing step 11.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the paper shape is shown with three small folds being made, indicated by arrows. Text 'step 11' is associated with these folds.

steps.instruction: The shape is now more defined, with the tail fins spread.
steps.visual_description: A paper shape with two distinct tail fins spread outwards. The top section is more pointed.

steps.instruction: Fold the entire structure flat, with a curved arrow indicating a fold downwards.
steps.visual_description: The origami shape is shown from the side, folded flat. A curved arrow indicates a fold downwards from the top section.

steps.instruction: The final shape is a flattened, layered structure.
steps.visual_description: A detailed view of the flattened origami structure, showing multiple layers and fold lines. The shape is wide and low.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami beta fish.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 10 of origami beta fish construction, with arrows indicating a fold.
Diagram showing step 11 of origami beta fish construction, with arrows indicating pinching the sides.
Diagram showing step 12 of origami beta fish construction, with arrows indicating small folds on the top point.
Diagram showing step 13 of origami beta fish construction, with spread tail fins.
Diagram showing step 14 of origami beta fish construction, with a fold indicated by a curved arrow.
Diagram showing step 15 of origami beta fish construction, a detailed view of the flattened structure.

projects.name: Origami Betafish

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to meet the center horizontal line, then fold the two side points inwards to meet the center vertical line.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on top and two flaps on the bottom. The top flaps are folded down to create a point. The side flaps are folded inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down again, and fold the side points inwards to meet the center.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 16, but the top point is folded down further, and the side flaps are folded inwards more sharply.

steps.instruction: Fold the entire model in half along the vertical center line. Then, fold the tail section outwards at an angle.
steps.visual_description: The model is folded in half vertically. A dotted line indicates a fold on the tail section, which is then shown folded outwards at an angle, creating a curved tail.

steps.instruction: The final step shows the completed origami beta fish with its characteristic flowing tail fins.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami beta fish with a triangular head and four flowing, ribbon-like tail fins extending from the body.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami beta fish.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 16 of folding an origami beta fish.
Diagram showing step 17 of folding an origami beta fish.
Diagram showing step 18 of folding an origami beta fish, including a fold line and an arrow indicating the direction of the fold.
Diagram showing step 19, the completed origami beta fish.

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Crease diagonally and horizontally/vertically. Fold all four corners towards the center point.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical dashed crease lines. Four curved arrows with open arrowheads indicate folding the corners inwards.

steps.instruction: Unfold the corners that were folded in step 1.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical dashed crease lines, and additional diagonal solid lines from the corners to the center. Four curved arrows with open arrowheads indicate unfolding the previously folded corners.

steps.instruction: Crease the paper horizontally and vertically into quarters. Fold the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal crease, and the left and right edges to the center vertical crease.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of 4x4 smaller squares formed by solid and dashed lines. Four curved arrows with open arrowheads indicate folding the outer edges inwards.

steps.instruction: Unfold the edges that were folded in step 3.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of 4x4 smaller squares formed by solid and dashed lines. Four curved arrows with open arrowheads indicate unfolding the previously folded edges.

steps.instruction: Collapse the paper into a triangle (likely a waterbomb base or similar). Fold the bottom corners of the triangle upwards along the dashed lines. Fold the right flap over to the left along the vertical center line. Perform a squash fold or similar action as indicated by the small double-arrow.
steps.visual_description: A grey shaded triangle with a vertical solid line down the center, a horizontal dashed line across the middle, and two dotted lines extending from the bottom center to the sides. Two curved arrows indicate folding the bottom side corners upwards. A large curved arrow indicates folding the right half of the triangle over to the left. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.

steps.instruction: The paper is now a diamond shape. Fold the side flaps inwards along the dashed lines. Perform a squash fold or similar action as indicated by the small double-arrow.
steps.visual_description: A grey shaded diamond shape. Two curved arrows indicate folding the outer edges inwards along the dashed lines. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.

steps.instruction: Further refine the top section. Fold the top corners of the side flaps inwards along the dashed lines. Perform a squash fold or similar action as indicated by the small double-arrow.
steps.visual_description: A grey shaded diamond shape. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top outer corners inwards along the dashed lines. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.

steps.instruction: Shape the sides of the model. Pull out or shape the side sections as indicated by the black arrows. Perform a squash fold or similar action as indicated by the small double-arrow.
steps.visual_description: A grey shaded diamond shape with two black solid arrows pointing outwards from the middle of the left and right sides, indicating a shaping or pulling action. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical dashed crease lines, with arrows indicating folding all four corners to the center.
Diagram 2 shows a square with a grid of crease lines, with arrows indicating unfolding the four corners previously folded.
Diagram 3 shows a square with a 4x4 grid of crease lines, with arrows indicating folding the outer edges inwards to the center lines.
Diagram 4 shows a square with a 4x4 grid of crease lines, with arrows indicating unfolding the outer edges previously folded.

Diagram 5 shows a grey shaded triangle with internal crease lines. Arrows indicate folding the bottom corners upwards and folding the right half over to the left. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.
Diagram 6 shows a grey shaded diamond shape. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards along dashed lines. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.
Diagram 7 shows a grey shaded diamond shape. Arrows indicate further folding of the top corners of the side flaps inwards along dashed lines. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.
Diagram 8 shows a grey shaded diamond shape with two black arrows pointing outwards from the sides, indicating a shaping or pulling action. A small double-arrow indicates a shaping action.

projects.name: Origami Figure

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the horizontal center crease.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal prism shape with a curved arrow indicating a fold from the top point downwards, meeting a horizontal dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point up to the horizontal center crease.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal prism shape with two curved arrows indicating folds from the top and bottom points towards the horizontal center dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards towards the center line, creating a narrower shape.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal prism shape with curved arrows indicating the sides being folded inwards towards the vertical center line. There are also small tick marks and dashed lines indicating where the folds should occur.

steps.instruction: Fold out the four flaps to form the legs/wings.
steps.visual_description: An origami figure with four flaps extended outwards from the central body. A curved arrow with a swirl indicates a rotational movement on the top flap.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides of the central body inwards.
steps.visual_description: An origami figure with four extended flaps. Two black arrows point inwards towards the center of the main body, indicating a pinching or folding action on the sides.

steps.instruction: Fold the tips of the four flaps outwards.
steps.visual_description: An origami figure with four extended flaps. Two small arrows point outwards from the tips of the side flaps, indicating a fold or spread.

steps.instruction: The figure is now complete.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami figure with a central body and four pointed appendages extending outwards. The top has three pointed sections.

projects.finished_product_description: A symmetrical origami figure with a central body and four radiating limbs, resembling a stylized insect or star.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 9 of an origami fold.
Diagram showing step 10 of an origami fold.
Diagram showing step 11 of an origami fold with directional arrows.
Diagram showing step 12 of an origami figure with flaps extended and a rotational arrow.
Diagram showing step 13 of an origami figure with inward folding arrows.
Diagram showing step 14 of an origami figure with outward folding arrows on flaps.
Diagram showing step 15, the completed origami figure.

projects.name: Origami Raptor

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper, folded in half diagonally.
steps.visual_description: A gray square with a dashed line representing a diagonal fold. Arrows indicate folding the top-left corner down to the bottom-right corner.

steps.instruction: Fold the square in half horizontally and vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A gray square with dashed lines representing horizontal and vertical folds, and a solid diagonal line from the previous step. Arrows indicate folding the top edge down and the right edge left.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom corners to the center line, aligning them with the diagonal crease. The fold should be approximately 1/4 of the way from the corner.
steps.visual_description: A gray square with horizontal, vertical, and diagonal dashed lines. Arrows show the top and bottom corners being folded inwards towards the center, with a curved line indicating the fold. A '1/4' is circled near the top-right corner.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inwards, aligning their edges with the center vertical crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape formed from the previous folds. Dashed lines indicate where the side flaps will be folded inwards. Arrows show the side flaps being folded towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the two outer edges inwards, creating new creases that are parallel to the center vertical line.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the previous folds. Dashed lines indicate new fold lines. Arrows show the outer edges being folded inwards, with small triangles indicating the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Open the model by pulling the top and bottom points outwards, while simultaneously pushing the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dotted lines indicating the extent to which it will open. Large arrows show the top and bottom points being pulled outwards and the sides being pushed inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the four points of the star shape outwards, creating the 'wings' of the raptor.
steps.visual_description: A star shape. Dotted lines indicate where the folds will occur. Arrows show the four points being folded outwards. A curved arrow indicates a turning motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the tips of the 'wings' inwards to create the raptor's claws or feet.
steps.visual_description: A star shape with four points. Dashed lines indicate where the tips of the points will be folded inwards. Arrows show the folding action.

steps.instruction: Fold the remaining two points of the star shape inwards to form the tail or head of the raptor.
steps.visual_description: A star shape with four points extended. Arrows show two of the points being folded inwards. Small triangles indicate the direction of the fold.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami raptor figure.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing 9 steps for folding an origami raptor.
Step 1: A square folded diagonally.
Step 2: A square with horizontal, vertical, and diagonal fold lines.
Step 3: A square with folds made towards the center.
Step 4: A diamond shape with side flaps folded inwards.
Step 5: A diamond shape with outer edges folded inwards.
Step 6: An illustration of opening the model.
Step 7: A star shape with points being folded outwards.
Step 8: A star shape with wing tips folded inwards.
Step 9: A star shape with two points folded inwards.

projects.name: Origami Raptor

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards as indicated by the arrows.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with four points, showing folds being made on the two side points, with arrows indicating inward movement.

steps.instruction: Continue folding the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 10, but the side points are folded further inwards, creating a more compact shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point upwards and then tuck it into the pocket.
steps.visual_description: The bottom point of the shape is folded upwards, and arrows indicate it being tucked into a central pocket.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps outwards and then fold the entire model in half.
steps.visual_description: The side flaps are shown being folded outwards. A circular icon with '1/2' and a curved arrow indicates folding the model in half. A large arrow indicates the direction of movement.

steps.instruction: Shape the head and tail by folding and creasing.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the side. Arrows and crease marks indicate the shaping of the head and tail sections, with some small triangular flaps being formed.

steps.instruction: Fold the wings upwards and refine the shape.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the side. The wings are being folded upwards. Arrows and crease marks indicate further shaping of the body and tail.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami raptor.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating steps 10 through 15 of folding an origami raptor.
Step 10 shows a diamond shape with side flaps being folded inwards.
Step 11 shows further inward folding of the side flaps.
Step 12 shows the bottom point being folded up and tucked into a pocket.
Step 13 shows side flaps folded outwards, followed by folding the entire model in half, indicated by a '1/2' icon and arrow.
Step 14 shows side view of the model with arrows and creases for shaping the head and tail.
Step 15 shows the wings being folded upwards and further shaping of the model.

projects.name: Origami Raptor

steps.instruction: Continue folding the origami raptor.
steps.visual_description: An origami raptor in progress, showing a fold on the head/neck area with an arrow indicating the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Continue folding the origami raptor.
steps.visual_description: An origami raptor in progress, showing a fold on the head/neck area with an arrow indicating the direction of the fold. This step appears to be a continuation or refinement of step 15.

steps.instruction: Complete the origami raptor.
steps.visual_description: A nearly completed origami raptor, showing the body, legs, tail, and head. The head is in a folded position, suggesting the final steps are being executed.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 15 shows an origami raptor in progress with a fold indicated on the neck/head.

projects.name: 6 Unit Ball

steps.instruction: Begin with a square piece of paper. Fold the four corners towards the center along the diagonal creases.
steps.visual_description: A square with two diagonal crease lines. Four red curved arrows indicate folding the four corners inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: Continue folding, creating additional creases and bringing more material towards the center, forming a smaller inner square.
steps.visual_description: A square with four diagonal crease lines, forming a smaller inner square. Four red curved arrows indicate folding the outer sections towards the center. A rotation arrow is present on the right.

steps.instruction: Allow bottom flaps to swing up. Fold the four outer triangular flaps inwards towards the center.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees (diamond shape) with an inner square formed by creases. Four red curved arrows indicate folding the four outer triangular flaps inwards towards the center. Text 'allow bottom flaps to swing up' is next to it.

steps.instruction: Further refine the folds, bringing the points closer to the center to define the unit's structure.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees (diamond shape) with a more defined inner square. Four red curved arrows indicate further folding or shaping of the central area. A rotation arrow is present on the right.

steps.instruction: Prepare a unit for assembly by folding the corners towards the center, similar to the initial steps, to create the basic module.
steps.visual_description: A square with two diagonal crease lines. Four red curved arrows indicate folding the four corners inwards towards the center. This diagram is labeled 'Assembly'.

steps.instruction: Shape the unit by gently pushing the center outwards or inflating it to give it volume.
steps.visual_description: A square with creases forming an inner square. A central circle contains multiple red arrows pointing outwards, suggesting inflation or shaping of the unit.

steps.instruction: Observe the finished unit or the assembled ball from the top view.
steps.visual_description: A square with creases forming an inner star-like shape, representing the finished unit or the assembled ball from a top view. This diagram is labeled 'Top View'.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami ball constructed from 6 identical units, as designed by Jonathan Blake.

Bottom image: A fully formed origami object made of orange and yellow paper, resting on a white surface. The object is a geometric star-like shape with six points, with alternating orange and yellow facets.

projects.name: Essence Container

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Green creases are partial folds only, layers do not press against each other.

projects.name: Millipede 1.0

steps.instruction: Fold in half and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangle with a single curved line indicating a fold from one edge to the other, with an arrow showing the fold direction. A dashed line indicates the center.

steps.instruction: Fold in quarters and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangle with two dashed lines indicating quarter folds. Curved lines with arrows show folds from the edges towards the center, meeting at the center dashed line. Small triangles indicate mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Fold in eighths and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangle with three dashed lines indicating eighth folds. Curved lines with arrows show folds from the edges towards the center, alternating directions and creating mountain folds indicated by triangles.

steps.instruction: Fold in sixteenths and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangle with seven dashed lines indicating sixteenth folds. Curved lines with arrows show alternating folds from the edges towards the center, creating mountain folds indicated by triangles.

steps.instruction: The strip is now creased into 16 segments. The following diagrams focus on only one segment.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangle with a circle highlighting one end, showing seven vertical dashed lines dividing the strip into 16 segments.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The final diagram shows the crease pattern for each segment. Red lines indicate mountain folds, and blue lines indicate valley folds.

projects.name: Concertina Folded Segment

steps.instruction: Fold corners to the top edge. Pinch crease only at the bottom edge. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal folds from the bottom corners to the top edge. Arrows show the direction of the fold. A label indicates 'Only pinch here' near the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Fold edges over to create creases at right angles to the pinch marks. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with two vertical dashed lines. The top edge has a curved line with arrows indicating folding inwards, creating a crease. The bottom edge also has a curved line with arrows indicating folding inwards, creating a crease. Right angle symbols are shown at the intersection of the curved fold lines and the dashed vertical lines.

steps.instruction: Fold edges to creases and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle divided by three vertical dashed lines and two solid vertical lines. Arrows indicate folding the outer edges inwards towards the center, creating curved folds.

steps.instruction: Concertina the segment. Mountain folds form new creases mid-way between existing creases. Valley folds are made on existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle divided by five vertical dashed lines, numbered 1 through 5. The bottom edge shows a series of alternating mountain and valley folds, creating a zig-zag pattern. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds. A separate diagram shows a zig-zag pattern labeled 'View from below' and 'Take note of the numbering'.

tips: Take note of the numbering when viewing from below.
projects.finished_product_description: A concertina-folded segment with alternating mountain and valley folds.

projects.name: Origami Model

steps.instruction: Fold section 1 in half and unfold. Fold all layers of section 1 only.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper object with a dashed line down the center and a curved arrow indicating a fold and unfold action.

steps.instruction: Fold section 1 in quarters and unfold. Fold all layers of section 1 only.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper object with two dashed lines indicating quarter folds and curved arrows indicating fold and unfold actions.

steps.instruction: Sink in and out on existing creases.

steps.instruction: The model should look like this. Repeat steps 15-17 on sections 2, 3 and 5.

projects.name: Centipede

steps.instruction: Scale view of entire model - one section completed. Repeat steps 6-32 on the other 15 sections!
steps.visual_description: A long rectangular strip divided into 16 equal sections by vertical lines. The first section on the left shows a detailed pattern of folded paper, suggesting it's a completed unit. The remaining 15 sections are blank rectangles.

steps.instruction: You should have something which resembles this. Curve the entire model lengthways so that the legs are parallel.
steps.visual_description: A long, segmented strip of paper, resembling a centipede. Each segment has multiple 'legs' or appendages extending downwards. The overall shape is slightly curved. The image shows a close-up of the completed model, with a box of '100 MINI CANDY CANES PEPPERMINT' in the background.

steps.instruction: Crimp/round/shape the ends to taste.

projects.name: Zelda's Triforce

materials.color: gold with black or white on the back

steps.instruction: Fold corner to corner; pinch in the middle and unfold. Repeat on each side.
steps.visual_description: An equilateral triangle with dashed lines indicating folds from each corner to the center of the opposite side. A curved arrow shows a fold from the bottom corner upwards, with a pinch mark indicated in the middle of the base.

steps.instruction: Fold point to its opposite pinch mark and unfold. Repeat with each point.
steps.visual_description: The triangle from step 1, now with additional dashed lines from each corner to the pinch marks on the opposite sides. A curved arrow shows a fold from the top point down to the center of the base, with a dashed triangle formed in the center.

steps.instruction: Fold in half; pinch in the middle and unfold. Repeat at other marks.
steps.visual_description: The triangle from step 2, with dashed lines indicating folds from the midpoints of the sides to the center. A curved arrow shows a fold across the top edge, with pinch marks indicated on the left and right sides.

steps.instruction: Fold the corner to the pinch mark (and line). Repeat for each corner.
steps.visual_description: The triangle from step 3, showing the top corner being folded down to meet the horizontal dashed line and the pinch mark on the opposite side. A curved arrow indicates this fold.

steps.instruction: Fold edge to crease made in step 2. Repeat for each edge.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape formed by the previous folds. The top edge is folded down to meet the horizontal crease line from step 2. Shaded triangles appear at the top corners. A curved arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold along creases made in step 2; "weave" the ends - see next step for layer positions.
steps.visual_description: The hexagonal shape from step 5, with the sides being folded inwards along the creases from step 2. A curved arrow shows one of the side flaps being folded. Shaded triangles are visible at the top and sides.

steps.instruction: Make sure the layers are as shown. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A larger view of the partially folded shape, showing how the layers interlock. An eye symbol with a curved arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Fold the point to the opposite edge. Repeat for each point.
steps.visual_description: The turned-over model, now appearing as a triangle with shaded flaps. The bottom point is folded upwards to meet the horizontal dashed line. A curved arrow indicates this fold.

steps.instruction: When folding the last corner, tuck it under the flap to lock the model. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-like shape formed by the previous folds. The last corner is being tucked under a flap to secure the model. A curved arrow shows the tucking action. An eye symbol with a curved arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Completed Triforce.
steps.visual_description: The final completed Triforce shape, composed of four smaller triangles. Three outer triangles are shaded, and one central triangle is white.

tips: Optional: Before locking the model (steps 8-9) insert a small magnet to create a fridge magnet.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper model of the Triforce from the Legend of Zelda series.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first fold of an equilateral triangle, folding a corner to the center of the opposite side.
Diagram showing the second fold, folding a point to a pinch mark.
Diagram showing the third fold, folding in half and pinching.
Diagram showing the fourth fold, folding a corner to a pinch mark and line.
Diagram showing the fifth fold, folding an edge to a crease line.
Diagram showing the sixth fold, folding sides along creases to weave the ends.
Larger view of the layered structure before turning over.
Diagram showing the eighth fold, folding a point to the opposite edge.
Diagram showing the ninth fold, tucking the last corner to lock the model.
Diagram of the completed Triforce model.

projects.name: Missile

steps.instruction: Fold in half, creasing on edges.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper. A curved arrow indicates folding the left edge to meet the right edge. A dashed line marks the vertical center crease.

steps.instruction: Crease only where shown.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper. Two diagonal dashed lines are shown, extending from corner to corner. Small curved arrows indicate creasing only at the ends of these diagonal lines, not across the entire length.

steps.instruction: Fold the diagonal, creasing only at the intersections.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper. One diagonal dashed line is shown. Small 'x' marks indicate specific intersection points along the diagonal. A curved arrow indicates folding a corner towards the center.

steps.instruction: Divide into thirds, using the crease marks as a guide.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with two vertical dashed lines, dividing the paper into three equal vertical sections. Small 'x' marks are present on the middle section. Curved arrows indicate folding the left and right edges towards the first and second vertical crease lines respectively.

steps.instruction: Divide the outer thirds into thirds, not creasing the middle.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper showing the previous two main vertical crease lines. Additionally, two more vertical dashed lines are added within each of the outer 'thirds', effectively dividing each outer third into three smaller vertical sections. Curved arrows indicate folding the outer edges towards these new crease lines within the outer thirds.

steps.instruction: Divide each third by half, not creasing the middle.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper showing all previous vertical crease lines. New horizontal dashed lines are added within each of the three main vertical sections, dividing each of these sections in half horizontally. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges towards these new horizontal crease lines.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow the sequence of folds to create the missile shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper missile, folded from a single square sheet, with a pointed front and a fanned tail section.

diagram_descriptions: Photo showing the finished origami 'Missile' model, made from light pink paper, viewed from the side.

Diagram 6: A square showing all previous vertical divisions, with new horizontal dashed lines dividing each of the three main vertical sections in half, and curved arrows indicating folds.

projects.name: Missile

steps.instruction: View from side. Collapse one of the larger triangles.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a rectangular shape with a pointed top. The top section has several triangular folds. Arrows indicate collapsing one of the larger triangles.

steps.instruction: Cutaway view. Fold the inside flap, locking the point.
steps.visual_description: A cutaway diagram of the top of the missile, showing an inside flap being folded to lock the point.

steps.instruction: Repeat with all the other points on top.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the top of the missile, with arrows indicating repeating the folding action on the remaining points.

steps.instruction: Collapse along pre-existing creases. The tail does not lock shut, but is held together from its own tension.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the bottom of the missile, showing dashed lines indicating pre-existing creases. Arrows indicate collapsing the tail section, which is described as not locking shut but held by tension.

projects.name: Pangolin

steps.instruction: Start with a square sheet of paper. Fold diagonally in both directions to create creases.
steps.visual_description: A square with two dashed diagonal lines and curved arrows indicating folds along these lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper horizontally and vertically to create creases.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed horizontal and vertical lines and curved arrows indicating folds along these lines.

steps.instruction: Collapse the paper along the creases to form a square base.
steps.visual_description: A square with internal dashed lines and arrows indicating the collapse action to form a square base.

steps.instruction: Observe the resulting square base, with two opposite triangles shaded.
steps.visual_description: A square base with two opposite triangles shaded grey, representing the layers of paper.

steps.instruction: Perform a petal fold on one flap of the square base.
steps.visual_description: A square base with dashed lines and curved arrows showing the process of a petal fold on one section.

steps.instruction: The resulting shape after the petal fold, showing a grid of horizontal, vertical, and diagonal lines. This forms the basis for the scales.
steps.visual_description: A grey parallelogram shape with a grid of horizontal, vertical, and diagonal lines. Small curved arrows indicate folding along the outer edges.

steps.instruction: Divide the grid further to create more scales. This is recommended for a more detailed model.
steps.visual_description: A grey parallelogram shape with a denser grid of horizontal, vertical, and diagonal lines. Small curved arrows indicate folding along the outer edges.

steps.instruction: Repeat the following steps (implied by 'x30') on the grid. Fold a section indicated by 1/4.
steps.visual_description: A grey parallelogram section with a grid. A vertical dashed line is shown with '1/4' next to it, and a horizontal double dashed line. An arrow points downwards with 'x30'.

steps.instruction: Focus on a corner of the grid where the pleats will be formed.
steps.visual_description: A grey parallelogram section with a grid. The top-right corner is circled, and a curved arrow points from the corner inwards.

steps.instruction: Unfold two pleats. Only unfold where they intersect.
steps.visual_description: A grey square section with solid and dashed lines. Two curved arrows indicate unfolding actions from the center.

steps.instruction: Detailed view of unfolding the pleats, showing multiple arrows indicating the direction of unfolding from the center outwards.
steps.visual_description: A grey square section with solid and dashed lines, and multiple arrows showing unfolding actions from the center outwards.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 10-11 on all other scales of the model.
steps.visual_description: A grey square section with solid and dashed lines, similar to the result of step 11. A curved arrow points to the right, indicating repetition.

steps.instruction: The full parallelogram grid with the pleat folds applied across the entire surface.
steps.visual_description: A grey parallelogram shape with a grid, showing the completed pleat folds across the surface.

steps.instruction: Shape the model to give it the pangolin's form.
steps.visual_description: A grey elongated shape with dashed lines indicating mountain/valley folds for shaping the scales and body.

steps.instruction: The completed pangolin model.
steps.visual_description: A grayscale rendering of the completed origami pangolin, showing its curved, scaled body.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow the folding sequence to create the pangolin's scales and body shape.

tips: It is easy to vary the scale sizes too. Make the scales smaller towards the head and tail.
Divide again to have more scales. (Recommended)
projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami pangolin model with a textured, scaled body, designed by Joseph Organtini and diagrammed by Joshua Goutam.

diagram_descriptions: A grayscale rendering of the finished origami pangolin model, showing its curved, scaled body, positioned at the top right of the page.
A grayscale rendering of the finished origami pangolin model, showing its curved, scaled body, labeled as '15. Completed Pangolin.' at the bottom center of the page.

projects.name: Mouse

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper oriented as a diamond. A dashed vertical line indicates a valley fold down the center, with a curved arrow showing the left half folding over to the right.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper oriented as a diamond. Two dashed lines indicate valley folds from the bottom point towards the top-left and top-right corners. Two curved arrows show the left and right sides folding inwards towards the center vertical crease.

steps.instruction: Fold behind.
steps.visual_description: A kite-shaped base. The top two corners are folded inwards along dashed lines, creating a smaller kite shape. Curved arrows indicate these folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top section down and then up.
steps.visual_description: The kite shape from step 3, with the top point folded down along a dashed horizontal line, and then the top section folded up along a dashed vertical line, creating a more elongated shape with a pointed top.

steps.instruction: Fold the top section down.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the folded paper. The top section is folded down along a dashed line, and a curved arrow indicates this fold.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the paper. A small section at the top is reverse-folded inwards, indicated by a black arrow.

steps.instruction: Pull open the center layers.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the paper. The top layers are being pulled apart and flattened, indicated by two curved arrows moving outwards.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: The paper is now a diamond shape with a flattened top. A dashed line indicates a fold from the top-right corner towards the center vertical line, with a curved arrow showing the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 8. Two dashed lines indicate folds from the top-left and top-right corners towards the center vertical line, with curved arrows showing the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 9. Two dashed lines indicate folds from the bottom-left and bottom-right edges towards the center vertical line, with curved arrows showing the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold behind.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 10. A dashed horizontal line is shown near the top, and a curved arrow indicates folding the top section behind.

steps.instruction: Collapse the figure on the creases previously made.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape with multiple dashed lines indicating existing creases. Four curved arrows show the process of collapsing the sides inwards and upwards, forming the final shape.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Begin with a square sheet of paper.

tips: This model can be folded with relatively small paper, provided it is thin.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami mouse with a long tail, sitting upright, with a small piece of origami cheese next to it.

diagram_descriptions: Title 'Mouse' by Joseph Slote - 짤 2010 - Rev 2.
Notes section: 'My goal for this model was to create a very long tail, making a kite base the perfect fit. This model can be folded with relatively small paper, provided it is thin.'

projects.name: Mouse - Joe Slote

steps.instruction: Squash fold.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two points at the bottom. The top point is folded down and squashed flat, creating a smaller diamond within the larger one. A curved arrow indicates the direction of the squash.

steps.instruction: Double reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 13. Two small arrows indicate folding two flaps inwards and upwards, creating a double reverse fold at the top.
The model from step 14. A curved arrow indicates a fold at the top point.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 13-15 on the other side.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 15. A box labeled '13-15' is shown on the right side, indicating repetition of the previous steps on the opposite side.
The model from step 16. A curved arrow indicates a fold on the left side of the top diamond.

steps.instruction: Flip model over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 17, flipped over. A dashed line indicates a fold.
The model from step 18. A curved arrow indicates a fold on the right side of the top diamond.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold through all layers.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 19. A dashed line indicates a fold line through all layers. A curved arrow shows the fold and unfold action.

steps.instruction: Open sink both edges.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 20. A dashed line indicates a fold. Two small arrows point outwards from the bottom edges, indicating an 'open sink' action.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 20-21 on the other side.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 21. A box labeled '20-21' is shown on the right side, indicating repetition of the previous steps on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Pull out the front flaps with one hand and the back flap with the other.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 22. Two curved arrows indicate pulling out flaps from the front and back.

steps.instruction: Side view
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model, showing the 'Head', 'Foreleg', and 'Back Leg' labeled.

steps.instruction: Pull on the flaps further and raise the center section from behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 24. Two arrows indicate pulling the flaps outwards. Another arrow indicates raising the center section from behind.

steps.instruction: Form these creases. This is similar to an Elias Stretch.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 25. A dashed diamond shape is shown, with arrows indicating the formation of creases. The text mentions 'Elias Stretch'.

steps.instruction: Bring the bottom flaps up and the left assembly down.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 26. Two curved arrows indicate bringing the bottom flaps up and the left assembly down.

steps.instruction: Continue collapsing.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 27. A curved arrow indicates continuing the collapsing action.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami mouse.

projects.name: Mouse - Joe Slote

steps.instruction: Continue collapsing.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin, pointed shape with several folded layers visible at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Front view
steps.visual_description: A pointed shape with a central vertical crease. The bottom section shows layers folded inwards, with a label 'Ears' pointing to two small triangular flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap down at the ears.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 30, but a flap above the 'ears' has been folded down, indicated by a curved arrow. Dotted lines suggest the fold.
The shape from step 31, with the flap from step 31 now folded down. The top point is sharp.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps at about the 1/3 mark. These will become the eyes.
steps.visual_description: The pointed shape from step 32. Two small flaps at approximately the 1/3 mark from the top are folded inwards, indicated by dashed lines and curved arrows.
The shape from step 33, with the flaps folded inwards. A curved arrow indicates a fold on the right side.

steps.instruction: Completed face.
steps.visual_description: The front of the mouse's face is formed. The folds from previous steps create a distinct face shape with two small points that could represent ears or eyes.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half and rotate it clockwise.
steps.visual_description: The completed face is shown folded in half along a vertical dashed line. A curved arrow indicates a 90-degree clockwise rotation.

steps.instruction: Fold the ear over. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the folded model. A flap on the top left is folded over, indicated by a curved arrow. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Fold the foreleg over. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 37. A section below the ear flap is folded over, indicated by a curved arrow. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Rabbit-ear the foreleg and fold the back leg. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 38. The foreleg section is being 'rabbit-eared' (a type of fold creating a point). A back leg section is also being folded, indicated by curved arrows. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Crimp the foreleg and rabbit-ear the back leg. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 39. The foreleg is being crimped (folded back and forth). The back leg is being 'rabbit-eared'. Curved arrows indicate the folds. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Crimp the foreleg and fold part of the back leg. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A detailed view of the mouse's leg. The foreleg is crimped. A portion of the back leg is folded. Dashed lines and arrows indicate the folds. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the tip of the front paw and crimp the back paw. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the mouse's paws. The tip of the front paw is reverse folded. The back paw is crimped. Arrows indicate the folds. The instruction 'Repeat behind' implies the same action on the opposite side.

Two square crease patterns labeled '2x2 Chessboard'. The first pattern is a 3x3 grid with additional diagonal folds forming a central octagon. The second pattern is a simple 2x2 grid.
A complex, diamond-oriented square crease pattern labeled 'Deer'.
A finished origami model of a deer with prominent antlers, facing left, rendered in shades of gray.

A rectangular box in the bottom right corner containing the text 'Joshua Goutam ORIGAMI' and two mirrored origami fox-like figures in shades of gray, with a curved arrow pointing from the left fox to the right fox.
Text 'Christmas Origami Book 2010' in the bottom left corner.
Page number '149' in the bottom right corner.

projects.name: Fish

steps.instruction: Fold the square diagonally in half, then unfold. Fold diagonally in half the other way, then unfold. Fold in half horizontally, then unfold. Fold in half vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating horizontal, vertical, and diagonal creases. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Bring the top, bottom, left, and right edges to the center crease, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating creases. Arrows show the edges being folded to the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the center.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top point folded down. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point up to the center.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top point folded down and the bottom point folded up to the center. An arrow indicates the bottom fold.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over and fold the bottom flap up.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape, viewed from the side, with the bottom flap being folded upwards. Arrows indicate the fold and rotation.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right side down.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with the top layer of the right side folded down. Arrows indicate the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the small triangular flap on the left upwards.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin triangular shape with a small triangular flap on the left side being folded upwards. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the left edge inwards.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin triangular shape with the left edge being folded inwards. Arrows indicate the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge upwards.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin triangular shape with the bottom edge being folded upwards. A dashed line indicates the fold line, and an arrow shows the direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the tip of the tail to create the fins.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin triangular shape representing the fish body. The tip of the tail is being folded to create fins. An arrow indicates the fold.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami fish.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold an origami fish, numbered 1 through 10. Each step illustrates a specific fold or series of folds with arrows indicating the direction of movement.

projects.name: Penguin

steps.instruction: Start with a square sheet of paper. Fold it in half diagonally, bringing the right corner to the left corner, creating a crease down the center. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper rotated 45 degrees (diamond shape) with a vertical dashed line down the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right half over to the left.

steps.instruction: With the paper folded into a triangle (point up), fold the bottom-right and bottom-left corners upwards along the dashed lines to meet the top point.
steps.visual_description: A triangle shape with the top point facing upwards. Two dashed lines extend from the bottom corners towards the top point. Two curved arrows indicate folding the side flaps up.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the model downwards along the horizontal dashed line.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. A horizontal dashed line is near the top. A curved arrow indicates folding the top flap down.

steps.instruction: Rotate the model 90 degrees clockwise. Perform an inside reverse fold on the top point to form the head/beak.
steps.visual_description: A vertical shape with a point at the top-left. A dashed line indicates the fold for the head. A curved arrow shows the rotation.

steps.instruction: Perform an inside reverse fold on the bottom-right flap to create a wing.
steps.visual_description: The penguin body shape. A dashed line indicates a fold on the right side. A curved arrow shows the flap being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Perform a squash fold at the bottom to create a stable base, and shape the back by pushing in along the indicated lines.
steps.visual_description: The penguin with arrows indicating pushing in the bottom to flatten it and shaping the back/tail area with small arrows.

steps.instruction: The finished origami penguin.
steps.visual_description: A fully formed origami penguin standing upright.

projects.finished_product_description: A standing origami penguin. The final illustration shows several finished origami penguins standing on an ice floe.

An illustration of a single finished origami penguin.
An illustration of multiple finished origami penguins standing on an ice floe.

projects.name: Skunk

steps.instruction: Fold the square diagonally from bottom-left to top-right, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed line representing a diagonal fold from bottom-left to top-right, and a curved arrow indicating the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left corner down to the bottom-right corner along the diagonal crease. Then, fold the top edge down to meet the diagonal crease.
steps.visual_description: A triangle formed by the previous fold. A curved arrow shows the top-left corner being folded down. Another arrow indicates folding the top edge down to the diagonal crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom-left edge to meet the center diagonal line. Repeat on the right side.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with a central diagonal line. Arrows show the bottom-left edge being folded to the center line, and the same action is implied for the right side.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down. Fold the two side points inwards, aligning them with the center.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a top point. Arrows indicate folding the top point down and the two side points inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left and top-right corners down to the bottom edge.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape. Arrows show the top-left and top-right corners being folded down to the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half along the center vertical line. Then, fold the top layer of the right side outwards.
steps.visual_description: A shape that is about to be folded in half vertically. Dotted and dashed lines indicate future folds. An arrow shows the top layer of the right side being folded outwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom-left flap upwards. Fold the bottom-right flap upwards.
steps.visual_description: A shape with two bottom flaps. Arrows indicate folding both the left and right bottom flaps upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half again, bringing the left side over to the right.
steps.visual_description: A shape being folded in half from left to right.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right side outwards to form a wing. Repeat on the left side.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape. An arrow shows the top layer of the right side being folded outwards to create a wing. A circular arrow indicates repeating the action on the left side.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami skunk, resembling a paper airplane with distinct wings.

projects.name: Przewalski's Horse

details.description: A complex crease pattern for an origami horse, featuring a grid of red (valley) and blue (mountain) fold lines. The pattern is symmetrical, with intricate sections at the top and bottom likely forming the head/neck and tail/legs, and a more central rectangular section for the body. The pattern includes numerous diagonal and orthogonal creases.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold the currency paper according to the provided crease pattern to form the Przewalski's Horse model.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami model of a Przewalski's Horse, folded from a US dollar bill, standing upright. The model captures the general form of a horse with a distinct head, body, and four legs.

A photograph of a finished origami Przewalski's Horse, folded from a US dollar bill, standing on a plain white background.
A photograph of two real Przewalski's Horses standing in a snowy, outdoor enclosure, providing a visual reference for the origami subject.
