steps.instruction: Fold the rectangle diagonally in half, then unfold. Fold the two side edges to the center diagonal crease.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a dashed diagonal line. Arrows indicate folding the side edges to the center diagonal crease. Small curved lines indicate mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal crease, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a horizontal dashed line in the center. Arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges to the center line. Small curved lines indicate mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 1 & 2 on the bottom.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with diagonal and horizontal dashed lines. Arrows indicate folding the side edges to the center diagonal crease and the top/bottom edges to the center horizontal crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a horizontal dashed line in the center. Arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges to the center line. Small square symbols indicate right angles.

steps.instruction: Collapse along existing creases, causing triangles ACE and FGH to stand perpendicular to square EFIJ. The model will not lie flat. The triangles ACE and FGH will act as tabs that fit into slots on adjacent units that start at I and J.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square labeled EFIJ with diagonal lines forming triangles. Points A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J are labeled. Arrows indicate collapsing the structure. A separate diagram shows a 3D representation of the unit with labels A, B, C, E, F, H, I, J.

steps.instruction: This is a complete unit. Make 6 units.
steps.visual_description: A 3D representation of the completed unit, labeled with points A, B, C, E, F, H, I, J. The text 'complete unit' is written next to it. The number 'x6' is written to the right.

projects.finished_product_description: A unit for constructing a Cubohemioctahedron.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A rectangle with a diagonal dashed line and arrows showing folding of side edges to the center.
Diagram 2: A shape with a horizontal dashed line and arrows showing folding of top and bottom edges to the center.
Diagram 3: A rectangle with diagonal and horizontal dashed lines, showing folding steps.
Diagram 4: A rectangle with a horizontal dashed line and arrows showing folding of top and bottom edges to the center.
Diagram 5: A square labeled EFIJ with diagonal lines forming triangles, showing the collapse into a 3D shape. Points A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J are labeled. Arrows indicate the collapsing motion.
Diagram 6: A 3D representation of the completed unit with labels A, B, C, E, F, H, I, J. Text 'complete unit' and 'x6' are present.

projects.name: Christmas Origami Star

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The ACE and FGH triangles lie flat against the back of the EFIJ squares when assembled.

projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped model with external faces formed by EFIJ squares and internal triangles ACE and FGH.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a star-like shape with points labeled A through J. Some internal triangles are shaded. The diagram is labeled 'top/inside view' and is numbered '6'.
Text describing the assembly of the model: 'each EFIJ square will become an external face of the model. The ACE and FGH triangles lie flat against the back of the EFIJ squares when assembled.'

projects.name: Dog bone Business Card Unit

steps.instruction: fold in half
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a dashed line across the middle, indicating a fold. Points A and B are marked on the top edge, and C and D on the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Make diagonal creases from corners to center of opposite edge.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines from the top corners to the center of the bottom edge, and from the bottom corners to the center of the top edge. Arrows indicate folding actions.

steps.instruction: reverse fold on crease
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a dashed diagonal line from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner. An arrow indicates a reverse fold along this line.

steps.instruction: repeat steps 2 & 3
steps.visual_description: A rectangle that appears to have undergone steps 2 and 3, resulting in a trapezoidal shape with some folded sections.

steps.instruction: completed basic unit
steps.visual_description: A completed unit shaped like a trapezoid with points labeled E and F at the bottom corners.

steps.instruction: add creases on both sides
steps.visual_description: The trapezoidal unit from step 5, with two dashed lines on each of the angled sides, indicating new creases.

tips: For some assemblies, an additional crease (6) is necessary. It is best to make this crease after the two units have been put together.
Other assemblies require additional creases in (6).
projects.finished_product_description: A modular unit for creating larger origami structures, described as a 'Dog bone Business Card Unit'.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to create a modular origami unit.
Diagram 1: A rectangle folded in half with a dashed line.
Diagram 2: A rectangle with diagonal creases and arrows indicating folding.
Diagram 3: A rectangle with a dashed diagonal line and an arrow for a reverse fold.
Diagram 4: A completed unit after repeating steps 2 and 3, showing a trapezoidal shape.
Diagram 5: The completed basic unit, a trapezoid with points E and F.
Diagram 6: The trapezoidal unit with additional dashed lines on the sides indicating creases.

projects.name: Business Card Jumping Frog

steps.instruction: Fold the top right corner down to the left edge, creating a diagonal crease. Fold the top left corner down to the right edge, creating another diagonal crease. These two creases should intersect in the center.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with two diagonal dashed lines forming an 'X' and two solid diagonal lines indicating folds from the top corners towards the center. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge down to meet the horizontal center line, creating a horizontal crease. Then, fold the top right and top left corners down to the center point where the diagonal creases intersect.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with an 'X' of dashed lines. A horizontal dashed line is shown across the middle. Arrows indicate folding the top corners down to the center intersection point.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge down to the horizontal center line. Then, fold the top corners down to the center point.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with diagonal creases. A horizontal dashed line is shown. Arrows indicate folding the top edge down and then the top corners to the center.

steps.instruction: Using the existing creases, bring the top edge down to CD while allowing the sides E and F to fall inward to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with diagonal creases forming an 'X' and a horizontal crease in the middle. Points are labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, and G. Arrows indicate bringing the top edge down and sides E and F inward.

steps.instruction: In progress.
steps.visual_description: Diagram labeled '4a in progress' showing a partially folded shape with points A, B, C, D, E, F, and G. The top section is folded down, and sides E and F are being brought inward. Diagram labeled '4b' shows the next stage where the top section forms a triangular shape with points A, B, C, D, E, F, and G.

steps.instruction: Fold points to the top.
steps.visual_description: Diagram labeled '5' showing the triangular top section from step 4b. Arrows indicate folding the points labeled A and B (which are the top corners of the triangle) downwards towards the top edge of the main body of the frog.

projects.finished_product_description: A jumping frog made from a business card.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating the steps to fold a business card into a jumping frog.
Step 1 shows initial diagonal folds.
Step 2 shows folding the top edge down and corners to the center.
Step 3 shows a similar folding sequence.
Step 4 shows bringing the top edge down and sides inward, with '4a in progress' and '4b' showing intermediate stages.
Step 5 shows folding points to the top to form the frog's head/front legs.

projects.name: Jumping Frog

steps.instruction: Fold small flaps in half
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with two triangular flaps at the top. Arrows indicate folding these flaps inward and then in half.

steps.instruction: Leave a small gap
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the previous shape with the top flaps folded. A curved arrow indicates a fold line across the middle of the main body of the shape.

steps.instruction: p2
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape after the fold in step 7. The top flaps are now folded down, and the main body is folded in half horizontally. A dashed line indicates a fold, and an arrow shows the direction of the fold. Tick marks indicate measurements along the bottom edge.
A diagram showing the shape from step 8. Arrows indicate folding the sides inward.

steps.instruction: fold flap in half
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 9. A flap at the bottom is indicated to be folded upwards. A bracket indicates the height of this flap.
A diagram showing the shape from step 10. The flap has been folded up. A curved arrow indicates a final fold or adjustment.

tips: Press down on point X and slide your finger off the back to jump
projects.finished_product_description: A completed frog that can jump.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial steps of folding a paper frog, with numbered steps from 6 to 8.
Diagram showing further steps of folding a paper frog, with numbered steps from 9 to 11.
A small diagram showing a folded paper shape, possibly a partially completed frog.
Text instructions for making the frog jump: 'press down on point X and slide your finger off the back to jump'.

projects.name: Business Card Ninja Star Unit

steps.instruction: Fold the business card in half lengthwise. The diagram shows folding the bottom edge up to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangle (representing a business card) with a dashed vertical line in the center. An arc with arrows indicates folding the bottom edge up to meet the center line. Two double-dash marks on the top edge suggest equal segments.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corners inwards towards the center, leaving a small gap at the top center.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangle with a vertical center line. Diagonal dashed lines extend from the bottom corners towards the top center. Curved arrows show the bottom corners being folded inwards. A small arc at the top center with hash marks indicates 'leave a small gap'.

steps.instruction: Fold the unit in half along the existing vertical crease made in step 1.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape (the result of step 2) is shown. An arc with arrows indicates folding the entire unit in half along its vertical axis, creating a smaller, thicker triangular shape.

steps.instruction: This is the completed single unit. Note the 'tab' and 'slot' for assembly. Four such units are required for the ninja star.
steps.visual_description: A right-angled triangular unit is shown. One corner has a small flap labeled 'tab'. The opposite side has an opening labeled 'slot'. The text 'x4' indicates that four identical units are needed.

pieces.name: Ninja Star Unit
pieces.shape: complex (starts as rectangle, folds into a triangular unit)

details.position: diagonal from bottom corners to top center

details.name: tab
details.location: one corner of the folded unit

details.name: slot
details.location: opposite side of the folded unit

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Four units are assembled by interlocking their tabs and slots to form a four-pointed ninja star. The assembly is noted as 'not very stable'.

tips: Assembly is not very stable.
projects.finished_product_description: A four-pointed ninja star constructed from four interlocking business card units.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Shows a business card with a central vertical dashed line and arrows indicating a lengthwise fold.
Diagram 2: Shows the folded business card with diagonal dashed lines from the bottom corners to the top center, and arrows indicating inward folds, leaving a small gap at the top.
Diagram 3: Shows the unit from step 2, folded in half along the central vertical crease.
Diagram 4: Shows the completed single unit, a right-angled triangle, with a 'tab' and a 'slot' labeled, and 'x4' indicating four units are needed.
Final Diagram: Shows the assembled four-pointed ninja star made from four interlocking units.

projects.name: Two Business Card Octahedron

steps.instruction: Fold one business card in half diagonally, then unfold. Fold in half along the other diagonal, then unfold. Fold in half vertically and horizontally, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle representing a business card with diagonal dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show folding in from the corners towards the center.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 1 on the second business card.
steps.visual_description: A second rectangle representing a business card with diagonal dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show folding in from the corners towards the center.

steps.instruction: Repeat the diagonal folds on all four corners of the first business card.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with diagonal creases meeting at the center. An arrow shows a corner being folded towards the center point.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges of the business card to meet the center vertical crease.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a pattern of intersecting diagonal lines forming diamond shapes. Arrows indicate folding the outer edges inwards.

steps.instruction: The diagram shows the result of step 4, with points labeled A, B, C, and D.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a grid of intersecting lines, forming diamond shapes. Vertical dashed lines are also present. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled at the corners.

steps.instruction: Perform an inside reverse fold on the top flap.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with diagonal creases. Arrows indicate an inside reverse fold on the top section. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled at the corners.

steps.instruction: Bring points A, B, C, and D together, using existing creases. The model will not lie flat as the middle of each side pushes out.
steps.visual_description: A 3D representation of an octahedron, showing the assembled form. Arrows at the base indicate the sides pushing outwards. Points A, B, C, and D are indicated at the base corners.

tips: Model will not lie flat as the middle of each side pushes out.
projects.finished_product_description: A geometric octahedron shape constructed from two business cards.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first step of folding a business card diagonally and then horizontally/vertically.
Diagram showing the second step of folding a business card diagonally and then horizontally/vertically.
Diagram showing the result of folding all corners to the center of a business card.
Diagram showing the result of folding the edges of a business card to the center crease, creating a diamond pattern.
Diagram showing the state of the paper after step 4, with points A, B, C, D labeled.
Diagram showing an inside reverse fold on the top section of the paper.
Diagram showing the final assembled octahedron shape.

projects.name: Modular Octahedron

steps.instruction: Fold two identical origami units.
steps.visual_description: Diagram (8) shows one such unit.

steps.instruction: Fit one unit upside down and rotated 90째 around the vertical axis.
Ensure the small internal flaps of the outer unit fit into the flaps of the internal unit.
Once the last flaps are inserted, friction should keep the model stable.

details.description: forming a central square and four triangular flaps

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble two units by fitting one upside down and rotated 90 degrees, interlocking the small internal flaps of the outer unit into the flaps of the internal unit.

tips: Friction should keep the model stable once all flaps are inserted.
projects.finished_product_description: An octahedron shape formed by assembling two origami units.

projects.name: Dual Tetrahedron Jewel

steps.instruction: Using only one unit, slip the flaps of points A and C under the flaps of points B and D.
steps.visual_description: Diagram at the bottom left shows the partially assembled unit.

steps.instruction: The internal flap between B and D will slide into the internal flap between A and C.

details.label: D
details.note: mentioned in text, not explicitly labeled in diagram

details.description: forming a central square and four triangular flaps

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble a single unit by slipping the flaps of points A and C under the flaps of points B and D, allowing the internal flap between B and D to slide into the internal flap between A and C.

projects.finished_product_description: A dual tetrahedron Jewel formed from a single origami unit.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram (8) shows a flat, diamond-shaped origami unit with internal fold lines forming a central square and four triangular sections. Points on the bottom edge are labeled C, O, B, A from left to right. The notation 'x2' is next to the unit, indicating two such units are required for the Modular Octahedron assembly.

Diagram at the bottom left shows a smaller, three-dimensional representation of the origami unit, partially assembled, with its flaps interlocked to form a compact polyhedral shape, illustrating the 'Dual Tetrahedron Jewel' assembly.

projects.name: Cube Stand

steps.instruction: Crease the paper diagonally from corner to corner.
steps.visual_description: A square with two diagonal dashed lines, forming an 'X' pattern, indicating valley folds.

steps.instruction: Fold each corner to the center point, creating a smaller square in the middle.
steps.visual_description: A square with solid diagonal lines and a smaller dashed square in the center, indicating the result of folding the corners towards the center.

steps.instruction: Make additional creases as indicated, likely by folding the edges of the inner square to the outer edges.
steps.visual_description: A square with solid diagonal lines, a smaller solid square in the center, and dashed lines extending vertically from the top and bottom midpoints of the inner square to the outer square's top and bottom edges.

steps.instruction: Collapse the model on existing creases. The model will not lie flat. Points A and B will come together, folding the ABC triangle in half. All the outer edges and the center will be raised.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed diagonal lines, a dashed inner square, and dashed lines extending from the inner square to the outer edges. Points A and B are marked on the top edge.

steps.instruction: Continue the collapse to form a 3D triangular shape.
steps.visual_description: A 3D triangular pyramid-like shape with points A, B, and C labeled, showing the model partially collapsed into a 3D form.

steps.instruction: There is a flap at B that can be folded inside the model if desired.
steps.visual_description: A 3D triangular pyramid-like shape, similar to step 5, but with points B and A labeled at the top, indicating a flap.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold corners to the center, then collapse along existing creases to form a 3D stand. A flap at point B can be folded inside.

tips: Post-it notes are perfect for holding business card cubes.
The sticky edge of the post-it notes should be along the white side of edge AB.
projects.finished_product_description: A completed 3D cube holder, appearing as a hexagonal prism base with a square opening on top, resting on a wider base, suitable for holding post-it notes or business card cubes. (Cube sold separately)

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square with two diagonal dashed lines, forming an 'X' pattern.
Diagram 2: A square with solid diagonal lines and a smaller dashed square in the center.

Diagram 3: A square with solid diagonal lines, a smaller solid square in the center, and dashed lines extending vertically from the midpoints of the inner square to the outer square's top and bottom edges.
Diagram 4: A square with dashed diagonal lines, a dashed inner square, and dashed lines extending from the inner square to the outer edges. Points A and B are marked on the top edge.
Diagram 5: A 3D triangular pyramid-like shape with points A, B, and C labeled.
Diagram 6: A 3D triangular pyramid-like shape, similar to step 5, but with points B and A labeled at the top, indicating a flap.
Final Diagram: A completed 3D cube holder, appearing as a hexagonal prism base with a square opening on top, resting on a wider base.

projects.name: Flintlock Pistol v2.0

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold diagonally in half, then unfold. Fold diagonally in half the other way, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with two dashed diagonal lines forming an 'X' and a solid line connecting opposite corners. Arrows indicate folding along the diagonals.

steps.instruction: This is the 'fish base'.
steps.visual_description: A square folded into a kite shape with creases visible. It appears to be the result of folding the edges to the center diagonal.

steps.instruction: Open side into model.
steps.visual_description: A three-dimensional representation of the paper, showing a flap being opened upwards from the center of the fish base.

steps.instruction: Rotate 45 degrees.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3 is shown rotated. One flap is folded down, creating a triangular shape.
The model is shown from the side. The top layer of the flap from step 4 is folded down, creating a curved top edge.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5 is shown. A small triangular flap at the bottom is being folded upwards and inwards.
The model from step 6 is shown. The top point is folded down.
The model from step 7 is shown. The sides are folded inwards towards the center line.

steps.instruction: Unfold to step 7.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown unfolded back to the state in step 7. The previous folds are visible.

steps.instruction: Closed sink.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 9 is shown. The top point is being pushed down and inwards, creating a sink fold.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse small flap. Internal layers will not be symmetrical; use your best judgment.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 10 is shown. A small flap on the side is being folded outwards and upwards. Text indicates asymmetry.

steps.instruction: Closed sink.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 11 is shown. A section is being folded inwards to create a closed sink fold.

steps.instruction: Closed sink to taste (no reference).
steps.visual_description: The model from step 12 is shown. Another closed sink fold is being performed, with a note that the exact fold is subjective.

tips: Internal layers will not be symmetrical; use your best judgment.
projects.finished_product_description: A flintlock pistol.

projects.name: Flintlock Pistol

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold and shape to taste.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a folded paper shape with an inside reverse fold, labeled '14'.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse and shape hammer to taste. Round the handle. Thin the trigger.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a folded paper shape with an inside reverse fold, with labels for shaping the hammer, rounding the handle, and thinning the trigger, labeled '15'.

tips: The barrel & handle can be shaped and make them 3D.
The hammer can also be thinned to taste.
Wet folding from a 12" is square makes for a nice prop.
projects.finished_product_description: A completed flintlock pistol made from origami. The model is approximately 5" long when made from a 6" square.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a folded paper shape with an inside reverse fold, labeled '14'.
Diagram showing a folded paper shape with an inside reverse fold, with labels for shaping the hammer, rounding the handle, and thinning the trigger, labeled '15'.
Diagram of a completed origami flintlock pistol.
Diagram of a partially folded origami flintlock pistol.
A small square labeled '6" square'.

steps.instruction: Valley fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A light green horizontal rectangle with the word 'ONE' visible in the center. A dashed horizontal line indicates the fold line across the center. A curved arrow points downwards, indicating a valley fold of the top half over the bottom half.

steps.instruction: Valley fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A blue horizontal rectangle, which is the result of the previous fold. A dashed vertical line indicates the fold line in the center. A curved arrow points from the right half to the left, indicating a valley fold of the right half over the left half.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the corner.
steps.visual_description: A blue rectangle, folded in half vertically. The top-right corner is valley folded diagonally inwards. A dashed diagonal line indicates the fold, and a curved arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up to meet the upper edge.
steps.visual_description: A blue rectangle with a green triangular flap on the right side (from the previous fold). The bottom-right corner of the blue layer is valley folded upwards diagonally, aligning its edge with the upper edge of the green flap. A dashed diagonal line indicates the fold, and a curved arrow shows the direction.

steps.instruction: Unfold along the center.
steps.visual_description: A blue rectangle with a green triangular flap on the right. The left side of the blue rectangle has a vertical dashed line, indicating the center. A horizontal arrow points to the left, indicating to unfold the left side of the paper, revealing the green side on the left.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the corner.
steps.visual_description: A blue horizontal rectangle, partially unfolded from step 5. The bottom-left corner is valley folded diagonally upwards. A dashed diagonal line indicates the fold, and a curved arrow shows the direction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up to match the edge behind.
steps.visual_description: A blue horizontal rectangle with a green triangular flap on the left (from step 6). The bottom edge of the blue layer is valley folded upwards, aligning with the bottom edge of the green flap. A dashed horizontal line indicates the fold, and a curved arrow shows the direction.

steps.instruction: Unfold along the center.
steps.visual_description: A blue horizontal rectangle with a green triangular flap on the left. A dashed horizontal line is visible across the top of the blue section, and a curved arrow indicates unfolding the top layer downwards.

steps.instruction: Precrease.
steps.visual_description: A blue rectangle with a green triangular section on the left. The blue section has multiple dashed lines forming an 'X' shape and a vertical dashed line in the center, indicating precreases. Curved arrows with small triangles indicate folding and unfolding along these lines to create the creases.

steps.instruction: Collapse along the existing creases (Waterbomb Base).
steps.visual_description: A blue rectangle with a green triangular section on the left. The blue section is now collapsed into a waterbomb base, showing a smaller blue square with green triangles on the top and bottom edges, and a central vertical dashed line. Curved arrows indicate the collapsing action along the precreases.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow folding steps to create the Dollar Bill Cat.

steps.instruction: Precrease along the angle bisectors (top layer only).
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape with two dashed lines forming an X at the front, and two curved dashed lines indicating precreases along the angle bisectors of the top layer.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear.
steps.visual_description: The front of the origami shape from step 19, with arrows indicating a fold inwards along the precreased lines, creating a 'rabbit ear' effect.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the flap in half.
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape with a flap at the front. An arrow indicates folding this flap in half with a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Spread squash the flap. The inner layers will fold in along existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape. An arrow shows the flap being opened and flattened, with dotted lines indicating where the inner layers will fold along existing creases.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the corner.
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape. An arrow indicates folding a corner with a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Pleat the flaps up.
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape. Arrows indicate pleating two flaps upwards.

steps.instruction: Crimp the flap up.
steps.visual_description: A green origami shape. An arrow indicates crimping a flap upwards.

steps.instruction: Completed Dollar Bill Cat.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami cat, made from a dollar bill, in a resting position. The cat has a head, body, and tail.

projects.name: Fox

steps.instruction: Start with a 4:12 sheet, divide in 48 squares.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dimensions labeled 4 and 12. The rectangle is divided into a grid of 4 columns and 12 rows, totaling 48 squares. Dashed lines indicate the grid.

steps.instruction: Crease and collapse like indicated.
steps.visual_description: The top section of the rectangle from step 1. Dashed lines indicate mountain and valley folds. The top corners are folded inwards, and the top edge is folded down.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle divided into a 4x4 grid of squares. Solid lines indicate the edges of the paper. Dashed lines indicate creases. Arrows show folds being made from the outer edges towards the center, creating triangular flaps.

steps.instruction: Precrease.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 3, but with additional dashed lines forming diagonal creases within the top two rows of squares. Arrows indicate folds along these new creases.

steps.instruction: Fold on existing creases and squash.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 4. The top section has been folded and squashed, forming two triangular flaps on each side. The overall shape resembles a stylized head with two pointed ears. The bottom section remains a grid of squares.

steps.instruction: Valley folds.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5. The bottom section of the paper is shown. A large curved dashed line indicates a valley fold. Arrows show the sides of the bottom section being folded inwards along diagonal creases, creating wing-like shapes.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold the nearest layers (mark) - Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6. The top section has been further manipulated, with the pointed top folded down. The side flaps from step 5 are now more defined. The bottom section shows the result of the valley folds from step 6, creating a wider base. A circular arrow indicates to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: The result.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami fox. It has a distinct head with pointed ears, a body, and four legs. The paper is creased and folded to create the shape of a fox.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami fox.

diagram_descriptions: A photograph of a finished pink origami fox, positioned on a green textured surface.

projects.name: Origami Fox

steps.instruction: Swivel fold
steps.visual_description: A gray origami base shape, wider at the bottom and tapering to a point at the top. The top section shows a swivel fold with dashed lines indicating internal creases and a central peak.

steps.instruction: Precrease like indicated
steps.visual_description: The same origami base shape as step 9. The lower, wider section now has a grid of dashed lines, forming a large 'V' pattern in the center, indicating precreases.

steps.instruction: The result
steps.visual_description: The origami base shape with the precreases from step 10 now visible as solid lines, indicating they have been made. The overall form is unchanged from step 10.

steps.instruction: Collapse like indicated and rotate 90 deg. ccw

steps.instruction: Inside crimp fold the neck. Extract the tail.

steps.instruction: Squash fold the face

steps.instruction: Shape
steps.visual_description: The origami fox shape is nearly complete, with distinct ears, a more refined head, body, and tail. Dashed lines indicate internal folds and shaping details.

steps.instruction: Finished fox
steps.visual_description: A fully formed, three-dimensional origami fox standing on all fours, showcasing the completed model with its distinct features like ears, snout, body, and tail.

steps.instruction:
Stand the two flaps up at 45째 to form the stand
Rotate 45째
Turn over
Enjoy

steps.instruction: Step 5 in progress. Keep pulling until the top is straight across, and not at an angle. Then flatten.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the top behind along the diagonal.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the side corners down.

steps.instruction: Squash fold to the right.

steps.instruction: Valley fold back to the left.

projects.name: Stealth Aircraft

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 10 and 11 on the other side.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold the wings out.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape with arrows indicating to fold the wings outwards using an inside reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the flaps at the front of the wings up, while squash folding at their bases.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate to valley fold the front flaps of the wings upwards. Another arrow indicates a squash fold at the base of these flaps.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the front down as far as you can.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. An arrow indicates to valley fold the front section downwards as much as possible.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold the two flaps out along the inner edges of the wings.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate to inside reverse fold two flaps outwards along the inner edges of the wings.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape with a circular arrow indicating to flip it over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the two flaps in half.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate to valley fold two flaps in half.

steps.instruction: Open the flaps and squash fold them.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate to open the flaps and then squash fold them.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the airplane in half.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper shape. A dashed line down the center indicates where to valley fold the entire airplane in half.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the wings down by bisecting the front.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper airplane. Arrows indicate to valley fold the wings downwards, with the fold line bisecting the front of the plane.

steps.instruction: Open out the wings and prop up the small stabilizers, as you're done with the Bird Base Attach Craft.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a folded paper airplane. Arrows indicate to open the wings and prop up the small stabilizers.

tips: If you've got duo paper, use it. A light colored bottom against a dark top makes BBF look like its got jet engine exhaust coming out above the wing, just like a stealth aircraft. Real stealth jets use such a configuration to keep their exhaust from being seen on the ground, by heat seeking missiles or unfriendly eyes...

steps.instruction: Start with the white side up. Fold the square paper diagonally in both directions and unfold to create crease lines.

steps.instruction: With the paper now a smaller square, fold the four outer edges of this new square towards its center.

steps.instruction: Pull out two opposite corners of the folded paper.

steps.instruction: Pull out the remaining two opposite corners.

steps.instruction: Fold the two bottom points (flaps) inwards towards the center.
steps.visual_description: The result of step 6. The four points where the corners were pulled out are marked with dots. Arrows indicate folding the two bottom points inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap downwards along a horizontal crease line.
steps.visual_description: The result of step 7. An arrow indicates folding the top flap downwards along a horizontal dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flap upwards along a horizontal crease line.
steps.visual_description: The result of step 8. An arrow indicates folding the bottom flap upwards along a horizontal dashed line.

steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a vertical structure with several horizontal lines. The bottom part shows a folded section with arrows indicating further folding.

steps.instruction: Repeat 3 more times.

projects.name: Owl

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold and unfold along both diagonals to create crease lines.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with two diagonal crease lines forming an 'X' across its surface.

steps.instruction: Rotate the paper to a diamond position. Fold the top and bottom corners towards the center point, aligning with the horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape. The top and bottom points are folded inwards along horizontal dashed lines, indicated by curved arrows pointing towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the left and right side edges inwards towards the vertical center line.
steps.visual_description: A kite-like shape. The left and right edges are folded towards the vertical center, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Fold the top two corners downwards and the bottom point upwards.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a shield or an inverted house. The top two corners are folded down, and the bottom point is folded up, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Pull out the top corners to form the owl's ears and the lower sides to shape the body. Begin to define the eyes.
steps.visual_description: A more defined owl shape. The top corners are pulled outwards (indicated by arrows) to form pointed ears. The lower sides are also pulled outwards (indicated by arrows). Eyes are sketched in.

steps.instruction: Refine the owl's face, shaping the beak and detailing the eyes.
steps.visual_description: The finished origami owl head, showing a distinct beak and detailed eyes.

projects.finished_product_description: A folded origami owl with distinct ears, eyes, and a beak, made from a single piece of paper.

diagram_descriptions: A large color photograph of a finished origami owl, made from brown/orange paper, with white paper inserts for the eyes, set against a light blue background.
Six numbered line diagrams illustrating the sequential steps of folding an origami owl, starting from a square piece of paper and progressing to the final head shape.

projects.name: Praying Mantis BP 3.5

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The blueprint shows a 16x16 grid with diagonal red lines, indicating the base structure for the origami praying mantis.

tips: It's a rough modification of an old design. Version 1.0 had a grid of 16x16 and this one has twice as big. This allowed me to shift the rivers to achieve proportions more accurate. It resembles Archmantis latistyla the best of all the Mantidae family. Kraft paper works very well with MC finishing.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami praying mantis model, specifically Archmantis latistyla.

diagram_descriptions: A detailed origami crease pattern for a praying mantis, featuring a 16x16 grid with blue fold lines and red diagonal lines. The pattern is divided into four quadrants, each showing intricate folding instructions.
Figure A shows the structure of the base, which is a line drawing of the initial folded form of the praying mantis.
Figure B shows the further shaping of the origami model, illustrating how to form the legs and body, including details.

projects.name: Slug CP

details.description: A complex crease pattern for the 'Slug CP' model, contained within a square boundary. The pattern features numerous intersecting lines representing mountain and valley folds, with a prominent radial fan structure originating from the bottom right corner. Intricate triangular and polygonal regions are visible throughout the pattern, particularly in the left and top sections.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: This is a partially closed sink. The area is mirrored on the lower part. This is also same with the other side.

tips: This is a partially closed sink. The area is also mirrored on the lower part. This is also same with the other side.
projects.finished_product_description: A folded origami model of a slug, depicted in profile. It has a long, slender body with a pointed tail and two small, upright protrusions at the head end, resembling antennae or eyes.

diagram_descriptions: A diagram showing the finished or partially folded origami model of a slug, with a long, tapered body and two small points at one end.

A detailed crease pattern (CP) for the 'Slug CP' origami model, presented within a square. The pattern is composed of many intersecting lines indicating mountain and valley folds, with a distinct radial arrangement of creases fanning out from the bottom right corner. Complex geometric shapes and folds are concentrated in the left and upper portions of the square.

projects.name: Clown

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold it diagonally in half and unfold to create a crease. Then, fold the top corner down to meet the center horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a diagonal crease and a vertical dashed line. An arrow indicates folding the top corner down towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down again, aligning it with the vertical center line.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 1 with the top corner folded down. A vertical dashed line is visible. An arrow indicates folding the newly formed top point down further.

steps.instruction: Fold the right side of the paper inwards along the vertical dashed line.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 2. A dashed line indicates a vertical fold on the right side. An arrow indicates folding the right section inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the left side of the paper inwards along the vertical dashed line.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3 with the right side folded in. A dashed line indicates a vertical fold on the left side. An arrow indicates folding the left section inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left and top-right corners outwards to form the 'hat' or 'hair' points. (The '2-4' label with an arrow points to the bottom, possibly indicating layers or a reference, but the visual instruction is for the top corners).
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 4, now a smaller diamond shape. Dashed lines indicate horizontal folds on both sides. Arrows indicate folding the top-left and top-right corners outwards. A '2-4' label with an arrow points to the bottom.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 5 with the top corners folded outwards. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point upwards.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 6 with the side flaps folded in. An arrow indicates folding the bottom point upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the very bottom tip slightly upwards to refine the shape.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 7 with the bottom point folded up. An arrow indicates folding the bottom tip slightly upwards.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami clown face with a white base and two blue pointed 'hat' or 'hair' sections. The face has drawn black eyes, a red circular nose, a red smiling mouth, and pink blush circles on the cheeks. Two gold circular embellishments are attached to the outer points of the blue sections.

diagram_descriptions: Step-by-step diagrams illustrating the 8-step origami folding process for a clown face.
A photograph of the finished origami clown face, decorated with drawn features and gold embellishments.
A portrait photograph of Rasputkina Anastasiya, 12 years, from Eniseysk, Russia, identified as the creator of the 'Clown' origami.

steps.instruction: White side up. Crease along the diagonals.

steps.instruction: Fold from the left corner to where the kite folds hit the edges. Only make sharp near the diagonal.

The fold line starts from the left corner and extends to the edges where the previous kite folds met. Dotted lines indicate the fold line. Arrows show the folding direction. Two small circles highlight points on the right edge.

steps.instruction: Fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with existing creases. The paper is folded in half vertically, with the right side folded over the left side. A dashed line indicates the fold. An arrow shows the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape formed by the previous fold. The top and bottom points are folded inwards towards the center vertical line. Dashed lines indicate the fold lines. Arrows show the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Unfold completely.
steps.visual_description: The paper is shown fully unfolded, revealing a complex pattern of creases. Arrows indicate the unfolding direction.

steps.instruction: Extend the creases.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with many existing creases. Arrows indicate the manipulation of several small flaps in the center, suggesting an internal fold or pleat.

steps.instruction: Fold the left corner.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with existing creases. The left corner is folded inwards towards the right. A dashed line indicates the fold. An arrow shows the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners on existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with existing creases. The two side corners are folded inwards along the existing creases. Arrows show the folding direction.

projects.name: Origami Kiwi

steps.instruction: Unfold completely.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, partially folded into a smaller square in the center, with curved arrows indicating the outer layers being unfolded outwards and upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with many existing crease lines. Two new diagonal dashed lines are shown in the upper right and lower left quadrants, with double-headed arrows indicating a fold and unfold action along these lines.

steps.instruction: Add two more creases linking the intersections of existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with numerous existing crease lines. Two short, new diagonal dashed lines are added, one in the upper right and one in the lower left, connecting specific intersection points of the existing creases. Arrows indicate the creasing action.

steps.instruction: Fold the angles in half. Now you're finally done precreasing (but trust me, it will make folding your kiwi a lot easier).
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with many creases. Two new horizontal dashed lines are shown, one near the top edge and one near the bottom edge, indicating folding the top and bottom angles in half. Arrows show the folding direction towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with many creases. A long horizontal dashed line indicates folding the entire paper in half, with a large curved arrow showing the downward fold of the top half over the bottom half.

steps.instruction: Reverse-fold..
steps.visual_description: A triangular piece of paper, the result of step 15. The top layer on the right side is being reverse-folded downwards and inwards, indicated by a curved arrow and a dashed line showing the new crease.

steps.instruction: Swivel-fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A more complex folded shape, elongated horizontally. A section on the right side is being swivel-folded, indicated by dashed lines and arrows showing the movement of layers. The instruction notes to repeat the action on the back side.

steps.instruction: Open-sink.
steps.visual_description: The folded shape from step 17. A section on the top right is being open-sunk, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow pointing inwards, showing the collapse of a point.

steps.instruction: We are about to do a complex twist. The good news is: all creases are already present. Step 21 will show the crease pattern of the entire model to ensure you have performed the twist correctly. Start by sharpening the edges and opening the paper. The model will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: A complex folded shape with multiple layers and visible creases. Arrows indicate various folding actions, suggesting the initial movements for a 'complex twist'. The shape is three-dimensional and does not lie flat.

steps.instruction: In progress. Fold the right raw corner to the left, making a small parallel pleat using existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A complex folded shape, similar to step 19. The right raw corner is being folded to the left, creating a small parallel pleat. This action is indicated by dashed lines and a curved arrow showing the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Result after the twist with its crease pattern.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper laid flat, displaying a detailed crease pattern. The pattern consists of numerous dashed and dash-dot lines, forming a central star-like shape with radiating lines extending towards the edges of the square.

details.description: A complex pattern of dashed and dash-dot lines forming a central star-like shape with radiating lines, indicating the folds for the 'complex twist' of the origami kiwi.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The crease pattern shown is the result of the complex twist, ensuring correct folding.

tips: Precreasing will make folding your kiwi a lot easier.
For the complex twist, all creases are already present. Step 21 shows the crease pattern to verify. Start by sharpening the edges and opening the paper. The model will not lie flat.
projects.finished_product_description: The final crease pattern of the origami kiwi after performing the complex twist.

steps.instruction: Valley-fold the feet.

projects.name: Fir Twig 1

steps.instruction: Use the billfold format obtained as a rest from an A4 square.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with the top half patterned with diagonal lines and the bottom half solid teal. A horizontal dashed line is present across the solid teal section, and a scissor icon is to the right of this line, with an arrow indicating a cut.

steps.instruction: Fold in half lengthwise.
steps.visual_description: A solid teal rectangle folded in half lengthwise, with a dashed line indicating the fold. An arrow curves down from the top edge to the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Precrease on both the front and the back side.
steps.visual_description: A solid teal rectangle with two horizontal dashed lines, one near the top and one near the bottom. An arrow curves from the top edge down to the top dashed line, and another arrow curves from the bottom edge up to the bottom dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold both layers.
steps.visual_description: A solid teal rectangle with horizontal dashed lines. A diagonal dashed line is shown from the top right corner, with an arrow indicating a fold along this line. The fold creates a triangular flap.

steps.instruction: Fold both layers behind. Pleat the triangles till the end of the paper, using the first triangle as a guide.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin rectangle with multiple diagonal dashed lines forming triangles. Arrows indicate a zig-zag folding pattern. The right end shows a small triangular flap being folded.

steps.instruction: Precrease through both layers. Unwrap.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin rectangle with a zig-zag pattern of dashed lines and arrows, similar to step 5, but with additional dashed lines indicating precreases. An arrow shows the paper being unwrapped.

projects.finished_product_description: A fir twig made from folded and pleated paper.

Page number '305'.

projects.name: Fir Twig 2

steps.instruction: Pleat, using the previously made folds.
steps.visual_description: A strip of paper folded into a zig-zag pattern with diagonal lines indicating pleats.

steps.instruction: Tuck flaps inside the model. The big flap should be locked to hold the tip together.
steps.visual_description: A row of triangular flaps being tucked into the main body of the model, with arrows showing the direction of tucking. One larger flap is shown being used to secure the tip.

steps.instruction: Precrease the flaps on both sides.
steps.visual_description: A row of triangular flaps with dashed lines indicating precreases on both sides. Arrows show the direction of the precrease.

steps.instruction: Inverse fold all the little flaps into a repeated pattern.
steps.visual_description: A row of triangular flaps with arrows indicating an inverse fold on each flap, creating a repeating pattern.

projects.finished_product_description: A decorative fir twig made from folded paper, shown from a side view and a top view.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a rectangular piece of paper with a grid of diagonal, horizontal, and dashed lines, indicating folding and creasing patterns.

Top view of the finished fir twig, showcasing the detailed, layered 'needle' effect.

projects.name: Mozilla Firefox (r) Logo

steps.instruction: Fold. There are not reference.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with two diagonal dashed lines and two horizontal and vertical dashed lines intersecting at the center, indicating initial valley folds.

steps.instruction: Continue folding as shown.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, transformed from step 1, divided into four smaller squares by solid lines. The top-right and bottom-left squares show diagonal dashed lines. The top-left and bottom-right squares are shaded, suggesting they are folded layers. An arrow points from the diagram of step 1 to this diagram.

steps.instruction: Squash, form the arm and circle.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a complex series of folds. A central area appears to be a squash fold, and various dashed lines indicate further folds and layers, beginning to form the circular body and an 'arm' of the logo.

steps.instruction: Add details to make it like this.

projects.name: Overgrown Snail

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper, folded in half diagonally, then in half again.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal creases forming an X, and a horizontal and vertical crease through the center. The paper is shown partially folded.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal creases. The four corners are folded towards the center, creating a smaller square with triangular flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold the top corners down to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square with creases. The top two corners are folded down along the diagonal creases, forming a kite shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. The sides are folded inwards towards the center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. The top point is folded down.

steps.instruction: Perform a closed sink fold on the top point. Repeat steps 5-6 on the left side.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. The top point is folded down and then sunk inwards. An arrow indicates repeating the process on the left side.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point upwards.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. The bottom point is folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the bottom point down.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a bird's head. The top layer of the folded-up bottom point is folded down.

steps.instruction: Perform a rabbit ear fold on the top flap.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a pointed flap at the top. The flap is being folded into a rabbit ear shape.

steps.instruction: Perform an outside reverse fold on the top point.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a pointed top. The top point is being folded outwards and then reversed.

steps.instruction: Pull out the paper to form the body.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a snail's body. A section of paper is being pulled out to create the elongated body.

steps.instruction: Perform an outside reverse fold on the head.
steps.visual_description: The head of the snail is being shaped with an outside reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Pull out the hidden paper to form the tail.
steps.visual_description: The snail shape is nearly complete. A section of paper is being pulled out from the bottom to form the tail. The numbers '5' and '2' are written on a flap.

tips: Closed sink!
Repeat 5-6 on left
rabbit ear
Outside reverse fold
pull out paper
pull out hidden and wrap around

projects.name: Fish

steps.instruction: Fold in half, horizontally and vertically. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, colored light blue, with dashed lines indicating horizontal and vertical folds. Arrows show the folding and unfolding action.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a fish with bubbles, and a hexagon with an eye inside. This represents the finished product or a conceptual representation.

steps.instruction: Divide in quarters horizontally. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, colored tan, with two dashed horizontal lines dividing it into three sections. Arrows show folding the top and bottom sections down to the center line and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Divide the lower and upper quarters in eights. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, colored tan, with dashed lines indicating horizontal folds. Arrows show folding the top and bottom sections down and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a fish with bubbles, and a hexagon with an eye inside. This represents the finished product or a conceptual representation.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the left. Valley fold the right.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, colored light blue, divided into vertical sections by dashed and dash-dot lines. Arrows indicate a mountain fold on the left side and a valley fold on the right side.

steps.instruction: Valley folds. The paper on the backside will go to the left.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape, composed of light blue and tan sections. Arrows show valley folds being made, with the tan section folding to the left.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold the corners.
steps.visual_description: A tall, narrow rectangular shape, colored light blue. Dotted lines indicate where to fold the bottom corners inwards using an inside reverse fold.

steps.instruction: The result of step 8.
steps.visual_description: A tall, narrow rectangular shape, colored light blue, showing the result of the inside reverse folds on the bottom corners.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a fish with bubbles, and a hexagon with an eye inside. This represents the finished product or a conceptual representation.

steps.instruction: Valley fold on existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape, composed of light blue and tan sections. Arrows indicate valley folds being made along existing dashed creases on the top and bottom sections.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the corners in.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape, composed of light blue and tan sections. Arrows show the top and bottom corners being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold inwards on existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape, composed of light blue and tan sections. Arrows show the sides being folded inwards along existing creases.

steps.instruction: Finished fish.

projects.name: Swift Cube -II

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold the paper along its diagonals.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with two dashed diagonal lines. Two curved arrows, one from top-left to bottom-right, and another from bottom-right to top-left, indicate folding and unfolding along these diagonals.

steps.instruction: First, create a 3x3 grid on the paper. Then, fold along the given lines, which include two main diagonals and two additional lines forming a V-shape.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper divided into a 3x3 grid by light solid lines. Two main diagonals are shown as dashed lines. Additionally, a dashed line extends from the bottom-left corner to the center of the bottom-middle square, and a dash-dot line extends from the top-right corner to the center of the top-middle square, indicating further fold lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners of the paper as shown, creating a central diagonal fold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape, wider than it is tall, formed from previous folds. A thick solid diagonal line runs from bottom-left to top-right across the center. The top-left and bottom-right corners are shown folded inwards along dashed lines, with curved arrows indicating the folding action.

steps.instruction: Fold and lock the flaps behind the upper layer.
steps.visual_description: A more complex folded unit, somewhat diamond-shaped, with a thick solid diagonal line running from bottom-left to top-right. Two horizontal dashed lines are visible, one above and one below the central diagonal. Curved arrows indicate parts being folded inwards and tucked behind existing flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold only the upper flap as indicated.
steps.visual_description: A folded unit, similar to step 4 but appearing more flattened. A dashed diagonal line runs from the top-left to the bottom-right. A curved arrow indicates folding the upper flap along this dashed line.

steps.instruction: The unit is now ready. Create 6 identical units and then assemble them to form a cube.
steps.visual_description: The final folded unit, appearing as a parallelogram with two vertical dash-dot lines, one on the left and one on the right, indicating connection points for assembly.

steps.instruction: Fold 1/3 of both sides inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold on the given lines, observing mountain and valley folds.

Two diagonal lines are drawn across the paper: one from the top-left corner of the second section to the bottom-right corner of the fourth section (dash-dot line for mountain fold), and another from the top-left corner of the first section to the bottom-right corner of the third section (dashed line for valley fold).

projects.name: Rock Dragon

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The diagram shows a complex origami crease pattern for a dragon.

tips: This dragon requires a lot of shaping. What I like about it is the versatility of the base. Points from the center can be pulled out to form spines. The claws are made in the same way as Satoshi Kamiya's Ancient dragon.

Also, the wings are made by pulling out two pleats and flattening them diagonally. Keep the top part of the wing flat and it will form a curved pleat across the wing. If it is done correctly, it should form a bat-like "finger" shown in the picture above. Good luck!
projects.finished_product_description: A white origami dragon with spread wings and a detailed head and body.

diagram_descriptions: A detailed origami crease pattern for a dragon, featuring many geometric folds and points.
A photograph of a finished white origami dragon, viewed from the side, showing its wings, head, and legs.
A photograph of the same white origami dragon, viewed from a slightly different angle, highlighting its wings and body.
A photograph of the white origami dragon, viewed from a low angle, emphasizing its profile and wings.

projects.name: The butterfly

steps.instruction: Fold the square paper in half horizontally and vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating horizontal and vertical folds, and curved arrows showing the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half vertically, then fold the top layer down.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle formed by folding the square in half vertically. The top layer is shown folded down, with dashed lines indicating further folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edges down to the center crease, creating a kite shape. Then fold the bottom edge up to meet the top edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the right side inwards, aligning the edge with the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps upwards, then fold the top corners down.
steps.visual_description: A shape with bottom flaps being folded upwards, and arrows indicating the top corners are folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half along the center line to complete the butterfly.

projects.name: Der helle Morgenstern

steps.instruction: All 20 strips are pre-folded so that 4 points are created. (Color side down). The start and end points overlap in the finished fold. Thus, three adjacent points of each strip are enclosed (1).
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a strip with dashed green lines indicating folds and a solid red line indicating a center fold. The strip is labeled '20x' on the left and 'B' on the right. Below the strip, 'L = 8xB' is written. Image 1 shows a pre-folded strip with points labeled 1, 2, and 3.

steps.instruction: 5 strips are woven together to form a kind of 'hut'. The second point of one strip is placed over the second point of another strip. The open ends form the 'hut rim'. To connect them, the diagonal folds of the segments are flipped, i.e., mountain folds become valley folds (2 ... 6).
steps.visual_description: Image 2 shows 5 pre-folded strips being assembled. Circles highlight points labeled 1, 2, and 3. Arrows indicate folding directions. Image 3 shows a partially assembled structure with clips holding parts together. Image 4 shows a more assembled structure with clips. Image 5 shows further assembly with clips. Image 6 shows a nearly completed star shape with clips. Image 7 shows the completed star shape with clips.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble 5 strips into a 'hut' by weaving and folding. Then assemble another 5 strips to form a second 'hut'.

projects.finished_product_description: A star-shaped origami model called 'Der helle Morgenstern' (The bright morning star) with 30 points. Its diameter is slightly larger than 4 times the strip width.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram of a rectangular strip with multiple dashed green fold lines and a solid red center fold line, indicating it is to be folded 8 times its width. L = 8xB.

Image 2: Five pre-folded strips being assembled, with points labeled 1, 2, and 3. Arrows indicate folding.
Image 3: A partially assembled star structure with clips holding segments.
Image 4: A more assembled star structure with clips.
Image 5: Further assembly of the star structure with clips.
Image 6: A nearly completed star shape with clips.
Image 7: The completed star shape with clips.

projects.name: Origami Star Ring

steps.instruction: The last 10 strips are woven into a sawtooth band. To do this, the strips are connected to each other one after another, as shown in Figure 8.
steps.visual_description: A sequence of folded paper units, each with numbered tabs (1, 2, 3) indicating connection points. The units are shown being linked together.

steps.instruction: The second tab of one strip is connected to the second tab of the other strip, and the third tab of the other strip is connected to the third tab of the following strip (markings).
steps.visual_description: Close-up view of two folded paper units being joined. Arrows indicate the insertion of tabs.

steps.instruction: The open ends form a band above and below the sawtooth row. Here, the diagonal folds of the last segments are also folded into valley folds to join them.
steps.visual_description: A row of folded paper units forming a band, with red clips holding some sections. Dashed lines indicate fold lines.

steps.instruction: The open ends form a band. Here, the diagonal folds of the last segments are also folded into valley folds to join them.
steps.visual_description: A row of folded paper units forming a band, with red clips holding some sections. Dashed lines indicate fold lines.

steps.instruction: The as-yet unwoven end strip is now woven together with the starting strip of the row. This creates a sawtooth ring from the sawtooth chain.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the final connection of the sawtooth chain to form a ring. Arrows indicate the path of the final strip being woven in.

steps.instruction: The two caps and the sawtooth ring (15) are clipped together.

steps.visual_description: A large origami star ring, viewed from the top, showing the central opening and the pointed 'teeth' around the edge.

steps.instruction: The two caps and the sawtooth ring (15) are clipped together. (16 + 17)
steps.visual_description: A large origami star ring, viewed from the top, showing the central opening and the pointed 'teeth' around the edge. Red clips are visible.

projects.name: Modular Origami Star

steps.instruction: Fold the two outer strips upwards.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of an origami star with two outer strips being folded upwards, indicated by black arrows and squares.

steps.instruction: Guide the inner strips past each other so the lower one lies over the upper one. The diagonal valley folds become mountain folds again. The two strips wrap around each other and form a point.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of an origami star showing the inner strips being guided past each other to form a point, indicated by black arrows and squares.

steps.instruction: The two outer strips are tucked over the inner one.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of an origami star showing the outer strips being tucked over the inner one, indicated by black arrows.

steps.instruction: The last point is closed. Before hanging, insert a thread loop into the center of a three- or five-pointed star group.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of an origami star with the last point being closed. A pair of scissors is visible in the foreground. A thread loop is being inserted.

steps.instruction: The completed morning star.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami star with multiple points, viewed from above.

steps.instruction: First, make the vertical mountain folds, then the valley folds in between. Next, make the 45째 folds.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of a folded piece of paper showing vertical mountain folds and valley folds in between, with 45-degree folds being made.

steps.instruction: Finally, make the horizontal folds. The strips are cut here.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of a folded piece of paper showing horizontal folds. The strips are indicated as being cut.

details.pattern: grid of squares with diagonal lines and small vertical lines

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow the folding and tucking instructions for each point. Insert a hanging loop before closing the last point.

tips: Enjoy the completed morning star.
The model was created in 1998.
The instructions were created on 21.04.2010.

projects.name: COME UN... GIOCO

steps.instruction: Start with A4 paper.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle labeled 'formato A4' with a vertical line down the center and a horizontal line near the top. The width is labeled sqrt(2) and the height is labeled 1.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper into three equal sections.
steps.visual_description: The rectangle from step 1 is shown folded into three vertical panels. The width is labeled sqrt(2) and the height is labeled 1.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: The three-panel rectangle is shown with the outer panels folded inwards, creating a narrower rectangle with two vertical creases.

steps.instruction: Make diagonal folds from the top corners towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flaps down and inwards, creating triangular shapes.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edges inwards.

steps.instruction: Open the 3D folds, fold the inner triangle, and refold.
steps.visual_description: Arrows indicate opening the structure, folding an inner triangle, and then refolding. The result is a more complex, layered shape.

steps.instruction: Fold down the triangular top.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 7 is shown with the top triangular section folded downwards. The text 'piegare in giu a triangolino' is present.

steps.instruction: Fold in half and rotate.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 9 is shown with the top point folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Interlock the flaps to close.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 10 is shown with flaps being interlocked to close the module. The text 'chiudere intascando' is present.
